First, it's not easy to make friend with anyone. I believe friends are people who have great compatibility with each other. After two years in college I have found sometimes there is more differences between people than similarities, for we are growing in the different families and was educated in various ways. Sometimes acquaintances are just acquaintances. We spend time together but we could never be friend. So, it's much easier to have some casual acquaintances than have some close friends.Second, close friends can easily understand each others feelings. Because of the similarity I talked before, acquaintances probably not able to understand you better than your friends. Moreover, they wouldn't even spare time to consider your feelings. Everyone play the role of acquaintance and friend at the same time. Being friendly is a good way to treat a acquaintance but way not enough for a friend. When my friend is sick, I would not only ask if he is okay like an acquaintance but do my best to make him get well as soon as possible. If my friend is going to the wrong direction in his life trail, I will try my best to pull him back, but not stand and stare like it's not of my business. And I believe my friend will do the same to me. In conclusion, a friend is a person you care about. To me, friends are the most important people in my life second to my family. I am the kind of person who has only one or two close friends, and I am fully content that I have such nice friends. If someone exchange my friends with thousands of acquaintances, I will definitely say NO.
llm: The idea that having a large number of casual acquaintances is beneficial has been a topic of discussion. However, I do not feel the need to emphasize the advantages of having a multitude of casual relationships. Instead, I firmly believe that having one or two close friends is far more valuable than having a large network of casual acquaintances.A friend is someone you genuinely care about, someone with whom you share a deep and meaningful connection. Close friends provide emotional support, comfort, and a sense of belonging. They are the ones who will be there for you through thick and thin, offering a listening ear and a helping hand. In contrast, casual acquaintances may be able to provide a fleeting sense of social connection, but they often lack the depth and intimacy that true friendships offer.Having a small circle of close friends allows for more meaningful and substantial relationships. With fewer, but more significant, connections, you can nurture and invest in those relationships, fostering trust, loyalty, and mutual understanding. This, in turn, leads to a stronger sense of identity and a more profound feeling of being understood and accepted.In conclusion, while having a large number of casual acquaintances may have its benefits, I firmly believe that having one or two close friends is far more rewarding. The intimacy, trust, and emotional support that close friendships provide are essential to our emotional and mental well-being. Therefore, I believe that it is better to prioritize quality over quantity when it comes to relationships, and to cultivate a small, but meaningful, circle of close friends.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Life today is easier and more comfortable than it was when your grandparents were children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The life today is totally different from half centuries before. Advances in technology do help humans to solve abundant of problems; however it also deprives of some things that we had. In my opinion, life in the old days brings more happiness to people than today for several reasons.The first reason is life is simple in the past. Nowadays, all humans compete together. Since world population getting higher, competition is getting fierce. If you are not able to handle your jobs, then someone will replace you right away. People need to put much more effort to keep their living condition. Therefore, lives in the old days is easier than today.Second, the environment today is serious damaged. Looking out the windows, what I see isn't sky, trees or mountains, but is coldly high buildings. Everyday, I walk on hard roads, breath in polluted air, and live in a limited space. What's worse, it has been proved that living in this kind of condition will result in some mental diseases. Thus, the environment our grandparents live is more comfortable than today.The third reason is that the pace of life. Today, we are able to read the news all over the world, to chat with people through the Internet, or to travel around the world by planes; however, it also means that any thing happens in the world will affect our life. If we cannot react properly and immediately, then we will be in a vulnerable situation. We have no choice but have to live in a fast pace.In conclusion, while there some people live in a pretty good condition, it is only a minority. People are put too much focus on making wealth and progress in technology; nevertheless, behind the glamorous facade of it, what we loss will never be returned.
llm: The life we live today is vastly different from what it was half a century ago. In my opinion, life in the old days brings more happiness to people than today for several compelling reasons. Firstly, life was simpler in the past. Without the complexities and distractions of modern technology, people had more time to focus on meaningful relationships, personal growth, and community building. The simplicity of life allowed individuals to appreciate the small joys and find contentment in everyday moments. In contrast, today's fast-paced and materialistic world often leaves people feeling stressed, anxious, and unfulfilled.Secondly, the environment today is seriously damaged. The old days were characterized by pristine natural surroundings, clean air, and pure water. People lived in harmony with nature, and the beauty of the environment was a constant source of inspiration and happiness. Unfortunately, the rapid industrialization and urbanization of the past few decades have taken a devastating toll on the planet, leading to pollution, climate change, and loss of biodiversity. This environmental degradation has significant implications for human well-being and happiness.Lastly, the pace of life is another significant factor. In the past, life moved at a slower and more relaxed pace, allowing people to savor each moment and appreciate the beauty of life. Today, the rapid pace of modern life leaves many people feeling rushed, overwhelmed, and exhausted. The constant pressure to keep up with the demands of work, social media, and other obligations can be overwhelming, leading to increased stress levels and decreased overall happiness. In conclusion, while modern life has its advantages, the simplicity, environmental purity, and relaxed pace of life in the old days are essential factors that contribute to a happier and more fulfilling existence.

question: High school should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Agree or disagree?
human: High school is the time when you decide your future career and particular field you want to concentrate and interested in. In my opinion high school should permit students to choose courses they want for several reasons which are freedom of choice, to have progress in students grades and knowledge as well as to help students explore their aptitude.First of all, as I mentioned above students should have a right to choose what they want to study. Not allowing students their desired subjects to be chosen is a restriction of human rights. As children of independent country we should know our rights and opportunities we have in order to achieve our goals and dreams.Next, students should choose their classes to have progress in their studies and grades. Also, we can avoid conflicts among students and teachers which can be enjoyable and productive for both instructor and students. For example, when I was taking art class everyone shared the same interests and it was easy to understand each other. Giving chance students to choose their interested fields of study is merit.Lastly, the most important reason I support this idea is he or she can explore in an area she/he has an aptitude. When schools can give such kind of opportunity the students are likely do their best and succeed in their future lives which is one of the point most people get education. Furthermore, this type of opportunities can raise future geniuses.In conclusion, as a young women I want my children to get knowledge they have desire to study in order to have distinguished achievement so it has advantage not only for him or her but for society as well. Having three reasons helps us to bring up students who are well-educated, with a bright and independent mind.
llm: High school is a pivotal stage in a student's life, marking the transition from adolescence to adulthood. It is during this period that students are expected to decide on their future career paths and the specific fields they wish to concentrate on. In my opinion, high school should permit students to choose courses they want, and this freedom of choice is essential for several reasons.Firstly, allowing students to choose their courses gives them the freedom to explore their interests and passions. When students are given the autonomy to select courses that align with their aspirations, they are more likely to be motivated and engaged in their learning. This, in turn, leads to progress in their grades and a deeper understanding of the subject matter. By permitting students to choose courses that resonate with them, they are able to develop a sense of purpose and direction, which is crucial for their future academic and professional pursuits.Moreover, permitting students to choose courses helps them explore their aptitude and strengths. By trying out different courses, students can discover their talents and areas where they excel. This self-discovery process is vital in helping students identify their career aspirations and make informed decisions about their future. Furthermore, when students are able to choose courses that they are interested in, they are more likely to develop a love for learning, which can have a lasting impact on their academic and professional lives.In conclusion, allowing students to choose courses in high school is essential for their academic, personal, and professional growth. By providing students with the freedom to select courses that align with their interests and passions, high schools can help students develop a sense of purpose, explore their aptitude, and make progress in their grades and knowledge. Ultimately, this can have a profound impact on their future career choices and overall success.

question: Some people are always in a hurry to go places and get things done. Other people prefer to take their time and live life at a slower pace. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether people have to live at a higher or lower pace, and this topic can also be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to be hurry to complete their tasks, while others seem to prefer the opposite position. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also develop my own perspective. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to live in a higher pace condition. The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that we need to save time for accomplishing some important tasks, and a fitting example of which can be found in my experience of missing exam. I just failed to participate in the university entrance exam because I thought I had enough time for eating breakfast and transporting to the testing place; while I was stocked in a traffic jam and then missed the first test. Therefore, we can start to agree that we have to be eager in our lives. Apart from the one I have mentioned above, another equally important aspect is keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. If I can avoid being a sluggish person, I can have a higher probability of fulfilling my dream successfully. For instance, I had spent more time on practicing playing piano so that I won a piano competition, defeating those spending less time on practicing. Hence, from this case we are capable of stating that keeping our pace higher is important. Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that with a slower pace can enjoy their lives more because it is not necessary for them to notice the time control or acquire the fame of succeed. However, from my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying. I do not think that those people with slower pace losing the piano competition can be really happy. In contrast, it is really joyful for me that I can immerse in the joy of the victory and accomplishment. Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that living in a higher pace is better because the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, I prefer to live in high pace. It is not to say, of course that other points of view are totally without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and plausible.
llm: The age-old debate about the optimal pace of completing tasks has sparked intense discussion among individuals. On one hand, some people tend to hurry to complete their tasks,On the other hand, others seem to prefer a more relaxed approach. After deeply pondering over this issue, I have developed my own perspective on the matter. In my opinion, being diligent and expeditious in completing tasks is the most beneficial approach.The first and foremost reason lies in the inevitable fact that we need to save time for accomplishing other important tasks. By hurrying to complete tasks, we can free up more time to focus on other pressing responsibilities, thereby increasing our overall productivity. In today's fast-paced world, it is essential to prioritize tasks and manage our time wisely to stay ahead of the curve. Rushing to complete tasks allows us to do just that,Another equally important aspect is that keeping a high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. When we work at a leisurely pace, it is easy to get complacent and procrastinate, leading to a decline in motivation and productivity. On the other hand, maintaining a rapid pace keeps me engaged, motivated, and focused, enabling me to deliver high-quality work while avoiding the pitfalls of laziness. Furthermore, working at a fast pace helps build discipline, resilience, and time-management skills, all of which are valuable assets in both personal and professional life. In conclusion, after careful consideration, I firmly believe that hurrying to complete tasks is the better approach. Not only does it enable us to save time for other important tasks, but it also prevents laziness, builds discipline, and increases productivity. By adopting this approach, we can achieve more in less time, leading to greater success and fulfillment in our lives.

question: Tourism is a multibillion-dollar industry that supports economic development. However, some people think that it causes too much damage to the local environment and culture. What do you think?
human: Tourist trade is becoming a powerful engine for the economy. Nevertheless, some individuals believe that this position ignores the ecological and environmental destruction, as a result of tourist activities, and its adverse effects on local communities and ecosystems. While both positions seem reasonable, my view is that, through proper management and regulation, a booming tourist industry is an excellent source of economic growth and wealth for rural and urban areas.The most obvious merit is that tourism can vastly boost economic development in a particular state or region. This takes place, not only through direct expenditure from tourists, but also because it provides direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, agriculture, and in the service industry. The increasing tax and the expansion of local markets for accommodation, luxury goods amongst others are also a result of a solid, well-regulated tourism programs. Furthermore, tourism provides a considerable number of direct and indirect jobs to the community, including retail, hotels, transport, agriculture, and in the service industry. This increase of job opportunities allows more people to make significant contribution to society through the purchasing of commodities by their growing incomes. As a result, this gives energy to the economic cycle, generating local economic prosperity in return.Some people may oppose these, citing the environmental and cultural destruction caused by tourism. In fact, compared to the tourism industry, other alternatives, like resource extraction and manufacture, are far worse destroyers. For instance, paper mills pour hundreds and thousands of tons of contamination into rivers, causing severe water pollution. On the other hand, the dramatic majority of tourist, particularly those who tend to spending a wealth of time and money locating and visiting rustic villages, are well educated. It is illogical to believe that these rational folks will not conduct themselves decently if required to do so.After careful consideration of both sides of the argument, the tourism sector is desirable for its important socioeconomic advantages. In conclusion, it is evident that under suitable administration, the benefits of tourism outweigh its drawbacks.
llm: The tourism industry has become a vital component of economic development in many states and regions around the world. By attracting visitors from diverse backgrounds, tourism can vastly boost economic development, generating significant revenue and stimulating local economies. One of the primary benefits of tourism is its ability to create both direct and indirect job opportunities for the community. This includes employment in retail, hotels, transport, agriculture, and the service industry, among others. As a result, tourism plays a crucial role in supporting the livelihoods of local residents and contributing to the overall economic growth of the area.However, not everyone views tourism as a positive force. Some people oppose the development of tourism in their region, citing the potential environmental and cultural destruction it can cause. The influx of tourists can lead to pollution, erosion of natural habitats, and strain on local resources. Additionally, the cultural heritage of a region can be compromised as traditional ways of life are disrupted by the influence of tourism. For instance, the construction of hotels and resorts can lead to the destruction of historic sites and the loss of cultural landmarks.Despite these concerns, it is possible for tourism to be developed in a sustainable and responsible manner. By implementing measures to minimize the environmental impact and preserve cultural heritage, tourism can be a powerful tool for economic development. This can include initiatives such as eco-tourism, which promotes the conservation of natural environments, and cultural tourism, which celebrates and preserves the unique traditions and customs of a region. Ultimately, when managed effectively, tourism has the potential to bring significant economic benefits while also protecting the environment and cultural identity of a region. By striking a balance between economic development and environmental and cultural preservation, tourism can be a valuable asset for states and regions seeking to boost their economic growth.

question: The government should allocate more funds to public services instead of wasting money on arts such as music, painting and so on. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your own opinion
human: The issue of governmental financing provision to aesthetic features in the society has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that the budget allocation to the arts is waste of national resources and the money should instead be spent on public services, I contend that this investment in field of the arts would be in the best interest of a society.First of all, there is no doubt that governments are liable for providing societies with appropriate public services and adequate facilities in an efficient way. Admittedly, no one should suffer from any sort of deficiency in field of health, education, transportation and communication. However, these could only help individuals with their physical requirements. There is also a burden on the government to highly concern about the people mental health initiatives which would be unconsciously or sensibly provided by the arts.On top of this, the arts play a pivotal role in all-round development of a society. No developed country could be named that music, painting, literature and other fields of arts are out of its government consideration. Enriching people's life and enlightening their thoughts, the arts basically affect the enhancement of societies in many positive ways.Furthermore, investing in art could bring employment opportunities and could end in return of capital occasionally. The investment could be paid back through the values of the created works of art which as a matter of fact should be considered as national possessions. To sum up, not only could investing in art be considered as wasting money at any kind, but also it would enriches the culture of the society and governments and individuals would benefit from it in multiple ways.
llm: The issue of governmental financing provision to aesthetic features in society has sparked a heated debate. On one hand, some argue that the budget allocation to the arts is a waste of national resources, which could be better spent on essential public services such as healthcare, education, and infrastructure. They contend that the arts are a luxury that societies can ill afford, especially during times of economic hardship. However, I strongly disagree with this viewpoint.On the other hand, I contend that investment in the field of the arts would be in the best interest of a society. The arts play a vital role in promoting cultural diversity, preserving national heritage, and fostering creativity and innovation. They also have a significant impact on the economy, generating revenue and creating jobs. Furthermore, the arts have the power to bring people together, promote social cohesion, and provide a platform for self-expression and social commentary. By investing in the arts, governments can enrich the lives of their citizens, promote national identity, and contribute to the development of a more enlightened and empathetic society.Moreover, the arts have been proven to have numerous benefits, including improving mental health, boosting tourism, and enhancing urban regeneration. They also provide a means of preserving history, promoting cultural exchange, and showcasing national talent. In conclusion, while some may view the allocation of governmental funds to the arts as a frivolous expense, I firmly believe that it is a wise and forward-thinking investment in the well-being and prosperity of a society. By supporting the arts, governments can reap numerous social, economic, and cultural benefits that will have a lasting impact on the lives of their citizens.

question: The idea of having a single career is becoming an old fashioned one. The new fashion will be to have several careers or ways of earning money and further education will be something that continues throughout life.
human: The career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. People usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. However, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security.A full time job with a steady income was enough for a potential employee to support himself and his family. But with the recent recession, almost all the countries all over the world are seeing significant economic downfall. This overwhelming crisis is prompting delayering and reduction of workers. As a result, people are focusing on doing several jobs or gaining further qualification to secure their economic condition.Moreover, the arrival of technology has also been playing a major role promoting further unemployment. The official term of it is named "Technological Unemployment". North American economists have published reports after scrutinizing the recent American economic situation that, technology is eliminating more jobs than creating one. For example, robots, automation and softwares are taking over manual human workers professions such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and specially in manufacturing companies. Thus many people's jobs are now at high stake. The best way to ensure a flexible earning is getting more jobs. Last but not least, corporational policy to to pay less to inferiors is another reason that drives labours to work on different sectors.For the reasons mentioned above, I believe that people are now more conscious to gain more educational qualification and also are more interested to work on various fields simultaneously to earn more and support themselves.
llm: The modern workforce has undergone a significant transformation in recent years. Unlike previous generations, who were content with a single, full-time job and a steady income, new generations are adopting a more dynamic approach to their careers. They are increasingly interested in pursuing multiple jobs and acquiring several higher educational certificates. This shift is largely driven by the desire to earn more and achieve financial security.In the past, a full-time job with a steady income was sufficient for a potential employee to support themselves and their family. However, the recent recession has led to a significant economic downfall in almost all countries worldwide. This has resulted in a loss of job security, reduced income, and increased uncertainty about the future. As a consequence, individuals are now seeking alternative ways to ensure their financial stability.The new generation's preference for multiple jobs and educational certificates is a response to this changing economic landscape. By diversifying their income streams and skill sets, they can better navigate the uncertainties of the modern job market. Moreover, having multiple higher educational certificates enhances their employability and opens up more career opportunities, allowing them to earn a higher income and achieve greater financial security.In conclusion, the traditional notion of a single, full-time job being enough to support oneself and one's family is no longer viable. The new generation's approach to career development, which involves pursuing multiple jobs and educational certificates, is a pragmatic response to the economic realities of the 21st century. As the global economy continues to evolve, it is likely that this trend will persist, with individuals seeking to future-proof their careers and financial stability in an increasingly uncertain world.

question: Some people think that computers are more of a hindrance than a help in today's society. Others believe that they are such indispensable tools that they would not be able to live or work without them. Discuss both opinions and give your opinion
human: Computer is a modern device that is useful for human life. People use computer particularly for work, study, even for communication. However, many people argue that computer more give obstacle than a help in social life. Other sides believe that it becomes prominent thing, and they cannot do anything without that device. However, I strongly believe that computer can influence society, and people's lives have already been controlled by device. I would argue that this modern device has been a major hindrance to some people. A study conducted by Mediabank shows that majority of Australian adults do not socialize with their families and friends as much as they used to, due to the fact that they spend almost nine hours a day dealing with computers as to produce efficient time in working. As it can be seen from the example, the idea that computers could be a help has been neglected.However, using computer can make people easier to complete their work. Businessmen, for example, use computer device to presentation or communication with their colleagues. Communication by feature-computer such as email and internet help busy businessmen to make deal with relation even in different country. This is due to using computer more efficient and, many workers cannot do more in work without computer.In conclusion, in era technology like this age, computer becomes important thing in human life. Every day, people cannot pass the day without stay in front of computer or using it. This situation becomes lifestyle habits, and nowadays human activities are influenced by computer use.
llm: The advent of computers has revolutionized the way people interact and live their daily lives. While many argue that computers create more obstacles than help in social life, I strongly disagree with this notion. In my opinion, computers have a profound influence on society and have already become an integral part of people's lives.On one hand, computers have made it possible for people to connect with each other across geographical boundaries. Social media platforms, online forums, and messaging apps have enabled people to stay in touch with friends and family, regardless of their physical location. This has helped to foster global communication and has bridged the gap between people from different cultures and backgrounds.On the other hand, computers have also become an essential tool for daily life. From online shopping to mobile banking, people rely heavily on devices to manage their daily affairs. Computers have also enabled people to access a vast array of information, educational resources, and entertainment options, making them an indispensable part of modern life.Moreover, computers have also transformed the way people work and learn. Remote work opportunities, as well as online courses and tutorials, have made it possible for people to acquire new skills and pursue career advancement from the comfort of their own homes. This has not only increased productivity but also provided people with the flexibility to balance their work and personal life.In conclusion, computers have already become an integral part of people's lives, and their influence on society is undeniable. Rather than being an obstacle, computers have opened up new avenues for communication, education, and personal growth. As technology continues to evolve, it is likely that computers will play an even more significant role in shaping our lives and society as a whole.

question: Some employers are giving increased importance to social skills. However, others still believe qualifications are the most important. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Ê
human: With the increased educational level of workforce, there are growing number of employers seeking criteria other than qualifications such as social skills in their employee selection process. However, some employers still believe that qualifications should be the most paramount criterion. The essay intends to explore both sides of arguments and also present my own opinion. Firstly, some people suggest that qualification should be the foremost measurement to determine the value of a employer. It is of importance that workers should be well educated and trained to perform duties of their job. Specifically, people who work in professional fields such as medicals are required to have a university degree and years of experience. Social skills seem to be less important as they cannot contribute to the success of a surgery. On the other hand, it is no doubt that the importance of social skills have been recognized by increasing number of employers. It is because people nowadays are required to work as a team in their jobs frequently. Interpersonal skill plays an essential role in helping colleagues to cooperate with each other, especially when conflicts arise. Better social skills allow them to resolve disagreements in a much more harmony way. Besides, organization have been transformed to customers oriented. Excellent social skills can help employees maintain strong relationship with their clients which thus lead to a better customer satisfaction.To my view, I incline to believe qualification is still the fundamental determinant of an employee's competency of their jobs. Yet, the importance of social skills should not be neglected as those skills can help one to perform their job effectiveness and efficiency by facilitating interaction and communication with others.
llm: The traditional approach to employee selection has long emphasized the importance of qualifications. However, a growing number of employers are now seeking criteria beyond academic credentials, such as social skills, in their hiring process. This shift in approach has sparked a debate among employers, with some still believing that qualifications should be the most paramount criterion.On one hand, those who advocate for qualifications as the primary selection criterion argue that they provide a clear indication of a candidate's expertise and knowledge in a specific field. They believe that a degree or certification is a tangible measure of a candidate's ability to perform a job. Moreover, qualifications are often seen as a guarantee of a certain level of competence, which is essential for complex and specialized roles.On the other hand, employers who prioritize social skills, such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving abilities, argue that these skills are essential for success in today's fast-paced and collaborative work environment. They believe that social skills enable employees to work effectively with others, to adapt to new situations, and to provide excellent customer service. Furthermore, social skills can be developed and refined over time, whereas qualifications are often fixed.In my opinion, while qualifications are important, they should not be the sole criterion for employee selection. Social skills are equally, if not more, important in determining a candidate's potential for success. Employers should strike a balance between the two, considering both the candidate's academic credentials and their social skills. By doing so, employers can ensure that they hire not only knowledgeable but also collaborative, adaptable, and customer-focused employees who can thrive in today's dynamic work environment. Ultimately, a holistic approach to employee selection will lead to a more effective and productive workforce.

question: Some people believe that charities should give aid to those who need the aid most, wherever they live. Some people believe that charity organisations would better concentrate on people in their own countries instead. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: The world has become more prosperous than ever yet a great number of people are still living in poverty or suffering by wars or disasters. Charity organisations have been playing an important role to provide support to those people. However, it is controversial whether the help should go to the people who need it most or the citizens of the country where the charity organisations are located. My view is that international aid should be prioritised.International aid is critical because people from other countries may be facing much more serious problems. Many people, for example in some African countries, are living below the basic standards. They lack food, water or clothes which keep them warm, not to mention the education needs. What is worse, people who live in countries that are confronted with wars or natural disasters are facing even more severe issues such as security, homelessness or the pain of losing best friends or family members. It is clear that those people are in desperate need of international support.Despite the importance of helping those beyond our national borders, it is reasonable to lend a hand to our fellow citizens. After all, charity organisations are mainly funded by the home country thus there is a high demand that the money should be spent in the place where it is collected. Another reason is that, even within the most developed countries, there are still poor people who lack their basic needs. By solving the problems in the home country, it is beneficial for social stability and steady economic growth.In conclusion, people from unfortunate countries need more international assistance while helping citizens in the home country is also necessary.
llm: The provision of international aid is a crucial aspect of global responsibility. It is essential to acknowledge that people from other countries may be facing far more severe problems than we can imagine. For instance, in some African countries, a significant number of individuals are living below the basic standards of living, struggling to access fundamental necessities like food, water, and shelter. These circumstances highlight the dire need for international aid to alleviate suffering and improve the quality of life for these vulnerable populations.The importance of extending a helping hand beyond our national borders cannot be overstated. International aid serves as a lifeline, providing essential support to those who are in dire need. It encompasses a wide range of assistance, including humanitarian aid, economic support, and development programs. By contributing to international aid efforts, we not only demonstrate our commitment to global welfare but also play a role in stabilizing and developing regions that are plagued by poverty, conflict, and natural disasters.Despite the significance of international aid, it is equally reasonable and important to prioritize lending a hand to our fellow citizens. Domestic issues and challenges within our own country should not be overlooked in the pursuit of helping others abroad. In fact, ensuring the well-being and stability of our own nation is foundational to being in a position to offer meaningful assistance globally. By addressing internal issues and supporting our own communities, we strengthen our capacity to contribute positively to the global community. Therefore, striking a balance between providing international aid and supporting domestic needs is essential. This balanced approach allows us to be responsible global citizens while also ensuring the stability and prosperity of our own nation. Through this dual commitment, we can work towards a more equitable and sustainable world for all.

question: Students at schools and universities learn far more from lessons with teachers than from others sources (such as the internet, television).To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: The way in which children today study is radically different from any previous generations, and the increased availability and relatively low price of modern technology has been instrumental in this change. Despite the argument of some people that learners can obtain more useful knowledge from teachers than from other sources, I firmly believe that both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods from educators are equally important in children's acquisition of knowledge.It is undeniable that the widespread of alternative sources of knowledge has played an important role in students' acquisition of knowledge. Computers can be programmed to provide an endless numbers of questions in diverse range of fields, and as the students answer these questions, the facts has been learned and reinforced. A case in point is the reading and listening parts of TOEFL iBT exams, as candidates have to answer many questions in a limited period of time. Moreover, when students have some academic problems, they can post those to some websites and receive correct answers from unknown people in faraway places without any costs. Besides, in the past, conducting a research require long hours of searching in library shelves, now all can be done at a click of a button. Thus, technologies are vital in students' learning.On the other hand, schools and university are places in which students gather to be educated and learn from each others as well as formal educators. At schools, students' development has been orchestrated stage by stage, step by step by experienced teachers, and their acquisition of knowledge is guided and backed up in a systematic way. Therefore, formal education approaches are also indispensable. To put it all in a nutshell, I pen out saying that alternative sources information and traditional education systems are equally important in children's development. So students should learn both from their teachers as well as modern technology to gain the best learning outcome.
llm: The way in which children today study is radically different from any previous generations. This significant shift can be attributed to the increased availability and relatively low price of modern technology, which has been instrumental in this change. Gone are the days of relying solely on textbooks and traditional teaching methods. With the advent of the internet, laptops, and mobile devices, students now have a plethora of information at their fingertips.The internet has opened up a vast array of alternative sources of knowledge, allowing children to explore and learn at their own pace. Online educational resources, such as interactive websites, educational apps, and video tutorials, provide a dynamic and engaging learning experience. Furthermore, social media platforms and online forums enable students to connect with peers and educators from around the world, facilitating global learning and collaboration.However, while alternative sources are invaluable, traditional teaching methods from educators remain equally important in children's acquisition of knowledge. Teachers provide guidance, support, and mentorship, helping students to navigate and make sense of the vast amount of information available to them. They also offer critical thinking and problem-solving skills, which are essential for students to effectively evaluate and apply the knowledge they acquire.In conclusion, the way children study today is a blend of traditional and modern methods. The increased availability of modern technology has revolutionized the learning process, providing students with a wealth of information and resources. Nevertheless, the role of educators remains vital, as they provide the necessary guidance and support to help students effectively acquire and apply knowledge. By striking a balance between alternative sources and traditional teaching methods, children can maximize their learning potential and thrive in an increasingly complex and interconnected world. Ultimately, this hybrid approach to learning will equip children with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in the 21st century.

question: Popular events like the football World Cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: A world sportive competition event is watched by almost every country around the world and provide social stimulus and people gathering. However, while people view these sportive events as vital in release international problems, others think that they are just entertainment to distract people. I believe that they are important somehow, but not essential.As a matter of fact, world sport events provide positive waves for number of people. The main purpose of such competitions is to enjoy and share emotions between supporters though their favorite team. These emotions are shared locally in our village or city, nationally in our own country but even internationally too. Obviously these events gather people and their nationalist pride feeling is increased. For example, the football world cup taking place every four years is a very followed event during which everyone is having fun.Moreover, these sports events are not essential in other issues such as politics or other international affairs. Thus, if the general atmosphere during the show is peaceful and fraternal, the reality is different. In other words, this is the "calm before the storm". After the Olympics games are finished, everything came back to normal and all the game competition is forgotten by the majority. To picture it, recently, Putin was pleased to open the last winter Olympic games and gather international countries, but actually it has been just facade and Putin didn't listen international warning after he conquered the Crimea.Finally, an international sports event is a very good thing to gather people, let them dream, being proud of their nationality and forget problems, but just for a while. These meetings are in none case here to interact with international affairs.
llm: The world of sports has long been a universal language, understood and celebrated by almost every country around the globe. Major sportive competition events, such as the Olympics and the World Cup, have become a staple of modern entertainment, drawing in massive audiences from diverse cultural backgrounds. These events provide a unique social stimulus, fostering a sense of community and togetherness among people from all walks of life. As fans gather to watch their favorite teams and athletes compete, social bonds are formed, and national pride is ignited.Proponents of these events argue that they play a vital role in bridging international divides and promoting global understanding. By bringing people together through a shared passion for sports, these events can help to release tensions and foster diplomacy between nations. The Olympic Games, for example, have a long history of promoting peace and unity among participating countries, with the Olympic truce being a prime example of this effort.On the other hand, critics argue that these events are merely a form of entertainment, designed to distract people from the pressing issues of the day. They contend that the spectacle and excitement of sports competitions serve as a diversion, drawing attention away from pressing global problems such as poverty, inequality, and conflict. According to this view, the frenzy surrounding major sporting events is a fleeting indulgence, offering temporary escapism rather than any meaningful solution to the world's complexities.Despite these differing perspectives, it is undeniable that major sportive competition events continue to captivate audiences worldwide, inspiring a sense of shared experience and communal joy. Whether seen as a force for international harmony or a mere entertainment spectacle, these events undoubtedly possess the power to unite people across borders and cultures, if only for a brief, shining moment.

question: Many people use distance-learning programmes (study material post,TV,internet...)to study at home. But some people think that it cannot bring the benefit as much as attending college or university. Do you agree or disagree?
human: With the tremendous development in information technology, long-distance education enables people to study at home without going to school. Whether this teaching approach is more beneficial to pupils than the traditional way sparks off a heated debate. From my perspective, I agree with the view that students can acquire more benefits from the remote education.To begin with, studying at home save the pupils enormous time and considerable expense. Students who use distance-learning programs can cut down their commuting time, tuition fees, textbook fees and so forth just by an internet connection. This especially makes a significant difference for the children who live in the far-off countryside and the children whose families are living below the poverty-line.Besides that, long-distance education provides students the opportunity to access the immense knowledge resources and a variety of teaching approaches. Pupils can obtain materials for their curricula just by one mouse click, such as science reports, study posts, documentary records, etc. A student can even select a specific online course based on his own preference and time schedule so he can control the learning progress and make satisfactory achievement on this course.It is undeniable that traditional education has its advantages in face-to-face communication, mental inspiration and physical educations. These make remarkable contributions in providing immediate feedbacks and cultivating pupils' personalities. But with the improvements in streaming and sensor technologies, remote education can eliminate the obstacles of distance and body contacts.In conclusion, I concede that traditional education has some merits like feedbacks and inspirations that cannot be replaced in the near future. However, distance-learning outweighs the conventional way not only with its efficiency, convenience and economic value, but also with the self-regulated education that pupils can study on their own purpose.
llm: The advent of distance-learning programs has revolutionized the way students access education. With just an internet connection, students can now cut down on various expenses associated with traditional learning methods. Commuting time, which can be a significant drain on a student's schedule, is greatly reduced, allowing for more time to focus on studies. Additionally, tuition fees and textbook fees are also lowered, as online resources and digital textbooks become more prevalent.Moreover, long-distance education provides students with the opportunity to access a vast array of knowledge resources that may not be available in traditional classroom settings. The internet offers a wealth of information, and online libraries and databases provide students with a vast repository of academic materials. This enables students to explore topics in greater depth and breadth, thereby enhancing their learning experience.Furthermore, distance-learning programs offer a variety of teaching approaches, catering to different learning styles and preferences. Students can choose from a range of courses and programs, tailored to their needs and interests. This flexibility allows students to learn at their own pace, and engage with course materials in a way that suits them best. The incorporation of multimedia resources, such as videos, podcasts, and interactive simulations, also enhances the learning experience, making it more engaging and effective.In conclusion, distance-learning programs offer a cost-effective and flexible way for students to access quality education. By reducing commuting time, tuition fees, and textbook fees, students can focus on their studies without the burden of excessive expenses. The vast knowledge resources and varied teaching approaches available online further enrich the learning experience, making distance-learning programs an attractive option for students worldwide. As technology continues to advance, it is likely that distance-learning programs will become an increasingly popular choice for students seeking to pursue their educational goals.

question: There are many extinct species in the world nowadays. Some people say we should protect these animals from dying out, while others say we should concentrate more on problems of human beings. Discuss both opinions and give your personal view.
human: Many animals today are in danger of extinction owing to various reasons. While some people believe it is important to protect these endangered species, others argue that problems of human beings deserve more attention. In my opinion, we should give priority to our own issues.Animal protectionists may base their argument on the ground that biodiversity is essential to maintain the balance of ecosystem. If certain species are absent from this system, such kind of balance is likely to be disrupted and other species, including human beings, will come under threat. Therefore, it is our responsibility to keep as many species on the Earth as possible.However, I think species extinction is quite natural according to the theory of evolution. The environment on the Earth has been transformed many times since the first species came into being. A great number of plants and animals died out because they were unable to fit into the new environment. On most occasions, the process of extinction of some species is irrevocable and we can do nothing about it.Furthermore, human beings nowadays are still faced with many urgent problems such as starvation, disease and wars. When these problems are taken into account, extinction of some animals recedes greatly in importance and it is not sensible to devote our limited resources to animals that have been past help. We should put our own survival and sustainment in order first before considering the conservation of other species.In conclusion, more emphasis should be laid on human beings other than animals, and it is better to let nature take its course with regard to species extinction.
llm: The debate surrounding animal protection has sparked intense discussions among conservationists and scientists. Animal protectionists often argue that preserving biodiversity is crucial to maintaining the delicate balance of ecosystems. They contend that the loss of species can have far-reaching and devastating consequences, such as disrupting food chains, disrupting nutrient cycles, and compromising the overall health of ecosystems. This argument is rooted in the understanding that biodiversity is essential for the resilience and adaptability of ecosystems, enabling them to withstand and recover from environmental stressors and disturbances.However, proponents of the theory of evolution counter that extinction is an inherent and natural process that has shaped the history of life on Earth. According to this perspective, species have always gone extinct as a result of competition, evolutionary changes, and environmental transformations. The Earth's environment has undergone numerous transformations since the emergence of the first species, with periods of rapid change and stability. This constant flux has led to the extinction of countless species, a process that is seen as an inevitable aspect of the evolutionary cycle.Despite this natural cycle of extinction, many argue that human activities have accelerated the rate of species loss to unprecedented levels, threatening the very foundations of ecosystems. The current rate of extinction is estimated to be 100 to 1,000 times higher than the natural rate, primarily due to human-induced habitat destruction, pollution, and climate change. Therefore, while extinction may be a natural process, the alarming rate at which it is occurring today warrants urgent attention and action to protect and preserve biodiversity. By acknowledging the essential role of biodiversity in maintaining ecosystem balance and the unnatural pace of current extinctions, we can work towards mitigating the impact of human activities on the natural world and preserving the rich tapestry of life on Earth.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
human: In today's context, education is the most significant factor which ultimately determines one's future. In my personal opinion, I am totally agreed with the view that there should not be any room for partiality in terms of gender while allocating seats for students in every university courses. There appear to be various reasons often strike in my mind in support of this position. To begin with, judging student's skills and abilities should only be based on their academic qualifications and talents rather than gender in particular. Nowadays, both male and female students are equally competitive to each other and deserve to produce impressive results in various field of education. In India, for example, female students are more often likely to grab more number of top scorer positions in every year higher secondary school examinations. Furthermore, female students are highly interested in learning courses such as mechanical engineering which demands physical activities in their lab workshops, unlike previous generation females. In addition, due to increasing exposure on current affairs and knowledge on cutting-edge technological developments, female graduates are more willing to take huge responsibilities in their workplace, despite its intensive stress and pressure. For example, Chanda Kochhar, who is the CEO of India's second largest bank called ICICI bank and prominently awarded as the country's most powerful female head in business sector. In conclusion, I am firmly supporting the view, that every student either male or female should be given fairly equal opportunity to purse their education in all university subjects, provided they should meet the required qualifications rather than putting limitations based on their gender. Government should take interim measures, to regulate admission process for university courses which enables every student to get benefit.
llm: In today's context, education is the most significant factor which ultimately determines one's future. It is the key to unlocking opportunities, fostering personal growth, and shaping the minds of tomorrow. As such, it is imperative that education is accessible and equitable for all, regardless of gender. In my personal opinion, there should not be any room for partiality in terms of gender while allocating seats for students in every university course.The reasons for this stance are multifaceted. Firstly, a gender-neutral admission policy promotes equality and fairness, allowing students to compete on a level playing field. It enables universities to select the most deserving candidates, based on their academic merit, skills, and potential, rather than their gender. This, in turn, leads to a more diverse and inclusive learning environment, where students from different backgrounds and perspectives can come together to share ideas and learn from one another.Furthermore, partiality in terms of gender can have far-reaching consequences, perpetuating stereotypes and limiting the opportunities available to students. For instance, if a particular course is dominated by one gender, it can create a sense of intimidation or discomfort for students of the other gender, hindering their ability to fully participate and engage with the course material. By eliminating gender-based partiality, universities can create a more supportive and empowering environment, where all students feel valued, motivated, and equipped to succeed.In conclusion, education is a fundamental right, and it is essential that it is accessible and equitable for all. By eliminating partiality in terms of gender, universities can promote equality, diversity, and inclusivity, ultimately shaping a brighter, more enlightened future for generations to come.

question: One of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing. Do you think the disadvantages of this development outweight the disadvantages?
human: Along with the development of technologies, advanced medical care has played an important role in the improvement of life expectancy. Although the increase in life expectancy has some pressure on the Medicare system, I am inclined to believe that the advanced medical care brings with it more benefits than disadvantages.The main advantage of high-tech medical care is that people are better taken care so that they have a good health. They can contribute effectively to the development of the economy because healthy workers can create more productivity. In other words, they do not have to spend more time in health checking or treatment so this saves an amount of time as well as cost.In addition, a community with the elderly who have a good health has a major role to play in a sustainable development of a society. In facts, young people will be happy as their parents, grandparents are healthy. It can be said that the improvement of medical care makes a better life for all people.On the other hand, some people maintain that the increase in life expectancy puts a high pressure on the economic system because more pension have to spend for Medicare instead of investing in other sectors of the economic system. Although it is real in some aspects, I believe that the capital that spend on taking care the elderly is contributed by these people during their working time, so they are worth to have good care. They have given their effort to the society so that young people, the governments have a responsibility to improve the Medicare system.By way of conclusion, it is true that the development of the health care system helps people have a better life. It helps people build a sustainable society where people can live a happy life when they are old.
llm: The significant increase in life expectancy over the past few decades can be largely attributed to the advancements in medical care. Advanced medical care has played a pivotal role in improving the quality of life and increasing the average lifespan of individuals. One of the primary advantages of high-tech medical care is that it enables people to receive better care, leading to improved health outcomes.With access to cutting-edge medical facilities and treatments, people are now able to manage chronic conditions more effectively, and recover from illnesses and injuries at a faster rate. This, in turn, has led to a significant increase in the number of healthy elderly individuals in communities. A community with a large number of healthy elderly members has a major role to play in the sustainable development of a society. Healthy elderly individuals are able to continue contributing to their communities, sharing their knowledge, experience, and wisdom with younger generations.Moreover, healthy elderly individuals are also able to maintain their independence, reducing the burden on caregivers and healthcare systems. This has a positive impact on the overall economy and social fabric of the community. Furthermore, a community with a high number of healthy elderly individuals is more likely to have a strong sense of social cohesion and community engagement, which are essential for sustainable development. In conclusion, advanced medical care has been instrumental in improving life expectancy, and a community with healthy elderly individuals has a vital role to play in promoting sustainable development and building a stronger, more resilient society. By prioritizing access to high-quality medical care, we can continue to promote healthy aging and build a brighter future for generations to come.

question: Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Others believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss these views. Which view do you agree with? Explain why.
human: The purpose of education is always a controversial topic among people and society, especially in high level such as college or university. Some people think that all students should deserve to be educated at this level. However, in my opinion, it should be better to leave this type of type of training for a certain group of good, knowledgeable learners.First, focusing only on talented students is a better option because it helps academic institutions maintain their high education quality. Unlike middle school or high school, university and college require far a lot of ability and skills to keep up with an enormous amount of complex knowledge. In fact, some students may be capable in high schools, but the pressure of higher education is tough even for talented ones. That explains why it is only suitable for a limited people, and opening up for everyone will be fatal for institutions, since they need to somehow lower the materials so that it is practical for everyone.Secondly, university should only accept good students because it gives better human resources for sophisticated purposes. Some people argue that this may lead to 'social division', when someone with high education refuses to do the called 'low jobs', but actually it gives no harm to the whole community. Those standard jobs will always be available for everyone, while complex ones should be only handled by the best people, who start their career from the best institutions. I think limiting the number of people who can be admitted by universities is a good choice since it will reward the motivation of students and constantly keep them in the difficult level of learning, which makes them do the best to improve themselves. Ultimately, this improves the overall quality of education and gives the best people to serve in the most necessary needs of the society.To sum thing up, I agree that everyone should have a compulsory education level up to high school, but the above divisions should be only the realm of the best students. This will improve the quality of both universities and students, thus placing people in positions which suit them most.
llm: The purpose of education has long been a topic of debate among individuals and society as a whole. While some argue that education should be accessible to all, regardless of their intellectual abilities, I firmly believe that it would be more beneficial to reserve this type of training for a select group of exceptional learners. By focusing solely on talented students, academic institutions can maintain their high standards of education quality.In my opinion, concentrating on gifted students is a more effective approach as it enables universities to produce better-equipped individuals for complex and sophisticated purposes. By accepting only top-notch students, the quality of education is likely to improve, resulting in more competent and skilled graduates. This, in turn, will provide society with a talented pool of human resources, capable of tackling intricate challenges and driving progress in various fields.Furthermore, accepting only good students allows universities to tailor their programs to meet the needs of high-achieving individuals, fostering an environment that encourages innovation, critical thinking, and intellectual growth. This selective approach also enables institutions to allocate their resources more efficiently, ensuring that the most capable students receive the support and guidance they need to excel.In conclusion, while the idea of inclusive education may seem appealing, I believe that reserving higher education for talented students is a more practical and effective strategy. By doing so, academic institutions can uphold their high standards, produce exceptional graduates, and ultimately provide society with a skilled and talented workforce. This approach may seem elitist, but it is essential for driving progress and meeting the complex demands of the modern world.

question: Agree or disagree? Universities spend money on improving facilities (labs and general requirements) better than hiring famous teachers.Ê
human: There is a hotly debated issue over whether universities should spend money on improving facilities is more than hiring famous teachers, and this topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to prefer that schools should invest in renewing facilities, while other seem to believe that famous teachers is more conducive to students. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to spend money on improving facilities. The first and foremost reason lies in an inevitable fact that the more advanced facilities we have, the more chances we can increase our knowledge. For example, library is a good place for students to study or research. They can concentrate on the subjects with a tranquil ambience; also, there are a lot of references for students to utilize. With this convenient and versatile facility, students can improve their learning condition. Therefore, we can commence to agree that certain facilities are beneficial to students. Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that students are not always staying in classrooms. They have numerous activities in school. Consider a circumstance in which a student who is a member of jazz ensemble in their school. He must need a better auditorium for him to have an extraordinary performance. With this distinguished performance, the student would acquire an unforgettable and valuable experience burring deeply in his mind. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that students would prefer school to spending on improving facilities.Admittedly, on the other hand, there might be some people proclaiming that schools should spend money on hiring prestigious teachers because they can impart their students well. However, according to my limited understanding, I just doubt the credibility of that saying owing to its imprudence. A student is good or not do not depend on whether he has a good teacher but is decided by his effort on study. It is useless to hire a super famous teacher to teach those who behaviors as sluggards. Based on the reasons demonstrate above, I believe that improving facilities is the best way for school because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the other. In other words, students can procure more advantages from better facilities. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I an firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
llm: The debate about how schools can best support their students' education has sparked a longstanding discussion. Some people argue that schools should prioritize investing in famous teachers, as they believe that renowned educators can provide students with a more engaging and effective learning experience. On the other hand, others contend that renewing facilities is the key to creating a conducive learning environment. After weighing the pros and cons of both options, I firmly believe that improving facilities is the best way forward for schools.Improving facilities offers a multitude of benefits that can enhance the overall learning experience. For instance, modern classrooms equipped with state-of-the-art technology can facilitate interactive and immersive lessons, making complex concepts more accessible and enjoyable for students. Moreover, well-maintained sports facilities and equipment can promote physical education and teamwork,. Furthermore, libraries with extensive resources and comfortable study areas can foster a love for reading and provide students with a quiet and focused space to study. In contrast, while famous teachers can undoubtedly bring prestige and expertise to a school, their impact may be limited to the specific subjects they teach, and their presence may not necessarily trickle down to other areas of the school.In conclusion, while having famous teachers can be beneficial, I believe that improving facilities is the more effective way to support students' education. By investing in modern and well-equipped facilities, schools can create an environment that caters to the diverse needs and interests of all students, ultimately leading to a more engaging, effective, and enjoyable learning experience. As such, schools should prioritize renewing their facilities to provide students with the best possible opportunities to thrive and succeed.

question: Do you agree or dis agree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: Some people state that high schools should allow students to study what they want to. They believe this motivates students to study. I think, however, students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics. I believe that tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university. In addition, it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles.To begin with, students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested. They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject. For instance, a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field.Next, students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields. General education plays a significant role in specialized education. Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics. In addition, although textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects. For instance, you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry. Therefore, high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university.Last but not least, students have tendency to shun difficulties. They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much. This might result in limited choices in the future. Therefore, schools should be responsible for their future and protect them.In summary, students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education. Besides, high school must be responsible for their future with well-planned curriculum.
llm: As students navigate their academic journey, it is essential for them to explore and discover their true passions and interests. Rather than prematurely deciding on a future major, they should be encouraged to try a broad range of subjects. This approach allows students to gain a deeper understanding of various fields of study, enabling them to make informed decisions about their academic and professional paths.Tertiary education plays a pivotal role in preparing students for specialization at university. It provides a foundation for students to explore different disciplines, from humanities to sciences, and everything in between. By exposing students to a wide range of subjects, tertiary education fosters a culture of curiosity and experimentation, allowing them to identify areas that genuinely captivate and motivate them.Moreover, trying a broad range of subjects helps students develop a more nuanced understanding of their strengths, weaknesses, and interests. It also enables them to recognize the interdisciplinary connections that exist between various fields of study. By doing so, students can make more informed decisions about their future majors, setting themselves up for success and fulfillment in their chosen careers.Ultimately, the goal of tertiary education is to empower students with the knowledge, skills, and passion to pursue their interests with purpose and dedication. By encouraging students to explore a broad range of subjects, we can help them unlock their full potential, leading to a more engaged, motivated, and successful academic and professional journey. In conclusion, students should be given the freedom to discover their interests and passions through a diverse range of subjects, ultimately preparing them for specialization at university and beyond.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Games are as important for adults as they are for children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: As people grow up, the arguments about the importance of games arise. Some people think that, adults need playing games as children do. However, in my opinion, games are no longer too important for them for several reasons.The first reason is that games become unnecessary for people when their careers begin. Someone may argue that games help adults relax and become more balanced in life. But, more often, the pressure of work and family commitment force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, and as a result, they cannot spend enough time and effort to their favorite games as they did in 15 or 20 years ago. For example, in my country, except for a minor part of professional athletes, the majority of people stop playing games seriously as soon as they find a decent job. They often feel that such games become more troublesome than enjoyable for their daily lives.Another reason should be mentioned is that adults often do not pursue games as a competitive activity, while children are always keen on competition and winning. For youngsters, maintaining their desire to win often develops many outstanding characteristics whether they participate sport events or not. For example, my younger sister likes fencing, and thanks to her desire to win, she never gives up when facing a difficult situation, or even becoming hurt. On the other hand, adults often consider such behaviors as childish and drop them immediately. In fact, a competitive person usually finds it difficult to cooperate with friends and colleagues. Because of that, they no longer play games for any moderate achievements, and gradually lose their interest in such activities.To sum up, I think adults do need to play games, but their styles are often distinct from children's, which are often less competitive and more enjoyable. Along with the high requirement for family and work, games are just some leisure activities for adults, not something necessary as they are meant to be for children.
llm: The notion that adults need to play games just as children do has been a topic of discussion in recent years. While some people believe that playing games is essential for adults, I strongly disagree with this statement. In my opinion, games are no longer as important for adults as they are for children, and there are several reasons to support this argument.One of the primary reasons is the pressure of work and family commitments. As individuals grow older, they take on more responsibilities, such as careers and family obligations, which demand a significant amount of time and energy. These commitments force them to abandon their lifelong hobbies, including playing games, in order to prioritize their duties. Adults have to manage their time wisely, and unfortunately, playing games often takes a backseat to more pressing responsibilities.Furthermore, adults have different needs and priorities compared to children. While games can be a source of entertainment and relaxation, they are not as crucial for adults as they are for children. Children need games to develop their cognitive and motor skills, as well as to learn social skills and emotional intelligence. Adults, on the other hand, have already developed these skills and can find other ways to relax and unwind, such as reading, exercise, or spending time with loved ones.In conclusion, while playing games can be a fun and entertaining activity for adults, it is not as essential for them as it is for children.
