Over the years, zoos have evolved to become popular destinations for entertainment and leisure. Many people visit zoos to marvel at the diverse range of animals on display, and to learn about the different species and their habitats. Proponents of zoos argue that they provide a unique platform for education and entertainment, allowing people to gain a deeper understanding and appreciation of wildlife.On the one hand, zoos offer a controlled environment where animals can thrive, and where visitors can observe and learn from them. Many zoos also offer interactive exhibits and educational programs, which can inspire people, especially children, to develop a love and respect for nature and wildlife. Moreover, zoos play a crucial role in conservation efforts, providing a safe haven for endangered species and participating in breeding programs to increase population numbers.On the other hand, there are those who vehemently oppose the idea of keeping animals in zoos, viewing it as a form of cruelty and exploitation. They argue that confining animals to small enclosures is inhumane and wrong, as it deprives them of their natural habitats and freedom. These critics also point out that many zoos prioritize entertainment value over animal welfare, and that the conditions in which animals are kept are often substandard. Furthermore, they argue that zoos do little to promote genuine conservation efforts and instead serve as mere spectacles for human amusement.Ultimately, the debate surrounding zoos is complex and multifaceted. While zoos can provide valuable educational and entertainment experiences, it is essential to ensure that animal welfare is prioritized and that these institutions operate with a commitment to conservation and ethical treatment of animals. By striking a balance between these competing interests, zoos can continue to serve as valuable resources for humanity, while also promoting the well-being and preservation of the amazing creatures that inhabit our planet.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: When I found the chance of studying in a group with my classmates, I wished I can go back in time and took all my exams again. I personally prefer studying in a group due to these noticeable features, getting help from other students, improving my attitude for learning, managing my time in an effective way.When pupils make a group for studying, all member of group have the same chance to help each other. They can work together for understanding the complicated aspect of a course. For example, when a group faces with complex math problem, they can share their opinions to solve it. In addition, such a remarkable effect has incorporation that all students can improve their weak points in a group. Increasing the motivation and competence spirit are another benefit of group-studying. In a group of student, the best of those always encourages others to study harder. Besides, pupils often have a tangible competence in order that they can get the highest grade in a group. Clearly, better learning is one of noticeable result of these competences and encouragements. When the students study with their friends, they should have schedule to use their time in an effective manner. Group-studying causes some kind of internal obligation to manage the time, inasmuch as we always care about other people and we do not want to waste their time. Therefore, time management is another brilliant benefit of group-studying. In conclusion, I strongly prefer studying in a group of my friends because of some important opportunities gaining with this activity. I can receive some helps from other student as well as improving my learning skills, also managing of time is another achievements of group-studying. Now, it is time to start without any regret from my previous exams.
llm: The method of studying is a crucial aspect of academic success, and it varies from person to person. While some students prefer to study alone, the benefits of studying in a group setting are undeniable. Personally, I strongly prefer studying in a group of my friends, and I believe that this activity provides numerous opportunities for growth and improvement.One of the primary advantages of group studying is the ability to receive help from my peers. When I am struggling with a particular concept or subject, my friends can offer explanations and insights that may have eluded me. This collaborative approach to learning enables me to gain a deeper understanding of the material, as we work together to clarify any misunderstandings. Moreover, being surrounded by friends who are also committed to learning creates a sense of camaraderie and motivation, which helps to keep me focused and driven.In addition to the academic support, studying in a group also provides an opportunity to improve my learning skills. By engaging in discussions and debates with my friends, I am able to develop my critical thinking and problem-solving abilities. Furthermore, the process of explaining concepts to my peers helps to solidify my own understanding, as I am forced to articulate my thoughts and ideas in a clear and concise manner. This, in turn, enhances my communication skills and boosts my confidence in expressing my opinions and perspectives.Overall, I firmly believe that studying in a group of friends is an invaluable experience that offers a multitude of benefits. Not only do I receive academic support and guidance, but I also develop essential life skills such as teamwork, communication, and problem-solving. As I continue on my academic journey, I am confident that the skills and knowledge gained through group studying will serve me well, both in and out of the classroom.

question: Some people prefer to spend time with one or two close friends. Other choose to spend time with a large number of friends. Compare the advantages of each choice. Which of these two ways of spending time do you prefer? Use specific reasons to support your answers.
human: Despite friendship is one of the most important values in a man's life, people might have different preferences: some of them prefer to spend time with one or two close friends, while other prefer to be surrounded by a large number of friends. In my view, I prefer the second attitude.The first reason is that staying in contact with a large number of friends gives the opportunity to learn more from the others' experiences. For instance, among a large number of people there could be someone who practices a particular sport, or plays an instrument or likes traveling very much and from their experiences you can be attracted to try something new that you had never considered before. Of course, while differences give the opportunity to learn, they can also mean that sometimes it can be difficult to reach an agreement. This would not happen or at least would happen rarely if one decides to spend time with one or two close friends. In fact, in this case it is more likely that interests and preferences are the same.Another reason is that a large number of friends can help you to consider all the possible solutions to a problem and to make you more open-minded. For example, if you happen to face a problem and ask them for advice, your friends you will see that issue from their different point of views and accordingly they will help you to consider better all advantages and disadvantages.When you have just few close friends, on one hand you develop a more intimate relationship with them and you feel you can trust them more, but on the other hand they often will give you viewpoints not so different from yours, adding less to your experience.In sum, although each choice - few close friends or a large number of friends - presents its advantages and its weak points, I think that spending time with a large number of friends can add more to one's life.
llm: The Value of Friendship: A Matter of Personal PreferenceFriendship is undoubtedly one of the most important values in a person's life, providing emotional support, a sense of belonging, and opportunities for personal growth. Despite its universal significance, people often have different preferences when it comes to nurturing friendships. Some individuals prefer to maintain a small, close-knit circle of friends, while others enjoy staying in contact with a large and diverse group of acquaintances. In my view, I firmly believe that having a large number of friends is more beneficial, as it offers a broader scope for learning and development.By staying in contact with a large number of friends, one is exposed to a wide range of experiences, perspectives, and ideas. This diversity can be incredibly enriching, allowing individuals to learn from others' successes and failures, and gain valuable insights into different cultures and ways of life. Moreover, a large social network provides a greater sense of security and support, as there are more people to turn to in times of need. In contrast, having a small circle of friends, while intimate and comfortable, may limit one's exposure to new ideas and experiences.Furthermore, in today's interconnected world, maintaining a large social network is easier than ever, thanks to social media and other digital platforms. This has made it possible to stay in touch with friends from all walks of life, regardless of geographical distance. In conclusion, while preferences may vary, I believe that having a large number of friends is more beneficial, as it provides a broader platform for learning, growth, and support. By embracing diversity and staying connected with a wide range of people, one can lead a more enriching, dynamic, and fulfilling life.

question: Should government spend more money on improving roads and highways or should government spend more money on improving public transportation (Buses, trains,subways)?
human: The development of public transportation is the most essential thing for a developed society. Public transportation keeps society from the depletion of natural resources, the air pollution, the loss of a sense of community. So, I think the government have to spend more money on improving it.The use of public transportation is the best way to conserve natural resources gradually run out. Cars depend on oil and gasoline to move. If people use too many private cars, the oil and gasoline nonrenewable will run out quickly. Instead of using many private cars, people can use public transportation, such as bus, train, subway, each one can get far more people and less oil and gasoline are used up per person.The use of public transportation helps in reducing the air pollution. Cars use oil and gasoline and send out gas such as carbon dioxide, heat and so on. They cause pollution and make the Earth warmer. The more cars are driven, the more pollution will be put into air. If we use the public transportation, less cars will be used and less pollution will be emitted. The atmosphere, surrounding us, will be protected and help us more healthy.The use of public transportation make us live more sociable. When we drive a private car, we are alone or only our family members that we already know and lost the opportunity to make friends with others or to see that we are a part of this society. When using public transportation, we have a chance to meet more people and more chances to discovery new aspects of life.Using public transportation has a lot of advantages for the modern society facing a lot of problems: the environmental population, the isolation in life, the depletion of natural resources. So, the government have to invest more for it and encourage people to use.
llm: The world is facing a critical issue: the depletion of natural resources. One of the most effective ways to conserve these resources is by using public transportation. Instead of relying on private cars, people can opt for buses, trains, and subways, which can transport a large number of individuals while using significantly less oil and gasoline per person. This reduction in fuel consumption not only helps to conserve natural resources but also minimizes the amount of pollution released into the air.The excessive use of private cars is a major contributor to environmental degradation. The more cars are driven, the more pollution is emitted, leading to a rise in global temperatures and exacerbating the issue of climate change. In contrast, public transportation offers a cleaner and more sustainable alternative. By using public transportation, individuals can significantly reduce their carbon footprint and contribute to a healthier environment.Moreover, using public transportation has a positive impact on social interactions. When people use buses, trains, and subways, they are more likely to engage with others, fostering a sense of community and sociability. This shared experience can help to break down social barriers and promote a more harmonious and connected society. In addition, public transportation provides an opportunity for people to interact with others from diverse backgrounds, cultures, and ages, broadening their perspectives and understanding of the world.In conclusion, the use of public transportation is a simple yet effective way to conserve natural resources, reduce pollution, and promote social interaction. By making a conscious choice to use buses, trains, and subways, individuals can contribute to a more sustainable and environmentally-friendly world. As we move forward, it is essential that we prioritize the use of public transportation and work towards creating a better future for ourselves and generations to come.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Animals should be free, people should not keep them in zoos. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people state that zoos are a great asset to animals. Others believe that they are inferior creatures and therefore do not deserve our attention. In my opinion, we must help animals live safely and comfortably in their own environment.Many scientific studies have revealed the detriment that zoos have caused to animals. Firstly, like we, human beings, animals are delivered to this world with genetic instincts. Skills which help them live and survive in their residing areas. When we captivate animals and put them to live a style of life that they are unfamiliar with, they begin to loose those in-born instincts. Hence, when they are released or in the worst case, when they escape, they act disorientated and this contributes to the animal mortality rate. In addition to the previous point, various zoos do not have the proper implements or policies that assure the quality of animal care. For instance, I recall my first trip to a zoo, at age eight. I was shocked by the cruelty which animals were treated. I can not think of any staff memeber who did not have an improper behaviour towards the animlas in the zoo. They beat them up because they did not wanted to eat their meals and then excused themselves saying that it was a way to train the animals.In conclusion, I strongly believe that we have to assit animals and provide them the best quality of life possible. Scientific facts showed the damage that zoos can inflict on animals. Moreover, many zoos do not meet the standards of care required for them.
llm: The debate surrounding the role of zoos in animal conservation has sparked intense discussion among animal lovers and critics alike. While many people argue that zoos are a valuable asset to animals, providing them with protection and care, others hold a contrasting view, believing that animals are inferior creatures and do not deserve our attention. In my opinion, however, I strongly believe that we have a moral obligation to help animals live safely and comfortably in their own natural environment.The primary goal of zoos should be to provide a safe haven for animals that are endangered or vulnerable in the wild. Unfortunately, many zoos fall short of this goal, instead prioritizing human entertainment over animal welfare. In contrast, conservation efforts that focus on protecting and preserving natural habitats allow animals to thrive in their own environment, free from the confines of enclosures. This approach not only promotes the well-being of individual animals but also helps to maintain the delicate balance of ecosystems.Moreover, by preserving natural habitats, we can also promote biodiversity and ensure the long-term survival of species. This can be achieved through the establishment of protected areas, such as national parks and wildlife reserves, where animals can roam freely and live as they would in the wild. Ultimately, it is our responsibility to ensure that animals are treated with the respect and care they deserve. By prioritizing their welfare and working to protect their natural habitats, we can help to create a safer, more sustainable world for all living creatures. By doing so, we can make a positive impact on the lives of animals and preserve the beauty and wonder of the natural world for future generations.

question: A university plans to develop a new research center in your country. Some people want a center for business research. Other people want a center for research in agriculture (farming). Which of these two kinds of research centers do you recommend for your country? Use specific reasons in your recommendation.
human: Most of the universities in the world seek to develop some research in some countries. These researches can be aimed for several fields such as business or agriculture. If a university plans to develop a new research in my country and I have to choose between establishing a centre for business research or a centre for agriculture research, I would opt for the second one.First of all, my country has a lot of land which is useful for the agriculture. Most of these lands are left without any treatment. The centre for research in agriculture can help my co-citizens to better exploit these land. This centre can also help people there to solve their issues related to their land. Especially, if they have no knowledge or education in this field.Secondly, the centre for research in agriculture helps the economy of my country to improve. The agriculture field has only thirty percent as a market part. The centre of research can raise the market part of this field by developing the agriculture products. For example, the dates are the most important agriculture product in my country. The centre of research for agriculture can make some research in how to get a good quality of this product, how to treat the Palme and maybe how to treat the land of the palms.Another reason that makes the centre of research for the agriculture more important than the centre of business research is that the first one can create a lot of jobs. Obviously, showing people how to exploit a land and get good agriculture products will push people to think about working in the field of agriculture rather than working in business or other field to make money. Some people think that a centre of business research is more important because we have to be in parallel with the advanced countries which have focused in business field. For me being a developed country does not mean that we have to focus only in business, but we have to focus on what really bring us to the level of self satisfaction, and the agriculture for our country is the field that can realize that.My country need to focus more on the agriculture by establishing centers for research in this field, which will have some very positive consequences on agriculture people work, on the economy and on the employment.
llm: As my country embarks on a new research endeavor, I firmly believe that establishing a center for agriculture research is the most prudent choice. This decision is driven by the vast potential of agriculture to positively impact our nation's development. First and foremost, a center for agriculture research can empower my fellow citizens to optimize the use of our land. By leveraging cutting-edge technologies and innovative farming practices, our agricultural sector can become more efficient and productive. This, in turn, can lead to improved food security, enhanced quality of life, and increased economic opportunities for rural communities. Our citizens will be able to better exploit the land, unlocking its full potential and contributing to the overall well-being of our society.Furthermore, the establishment of an agriculture research center can play a pivotal role in bolstering our country's economy. Currently, the agriculture sector accounts for only thirty percent of the market share, indicating substantial room for growth and expansion. By investing in research and development, we can identify new avenues for agricultural growth, improve crop yields, and diversify our agricultural products. This can lead to increased exports, higher revenues, and a more resilient economy. The potential for job creation, both directly in farming and indirectly in related industries, is also significant, further contributing to economic improvement.In conclusion, the benefits of establishing a center for agriculture research are multifaceted and far-reaching. It not only aids in the optimal utilization of our land but also presents a viable pathway to economic enhancement. Given the current underrepresentation of agriculture in our market, the potential for expansion and the positive impacts that come with it make this choice particularly compelling. Therefore, I strongly advocate for the development of a center for agriculture research as the most beneficial direction for our country's new research initiative.

question: People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things, other people learn by reading about things, others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
human: People have a lot of things to learn in their lives. They use several ways to broaden their knowledge and their skills. One of these several ways of learning that I prefer is doing things by my self rather than learning by reading about things or learning by listening to people talking about. There are a lot of reasons to recommend this method for who is serious about learning some thing in their lives.First of all, learning by doing things develops our maturity. When you do things by your self, you learn to depend on yourself. You will not be in need to refer to books or persons. The fact of doing things by ourselves can help us to get some experiences that would strong our maturity. For example if some one wants to learn how to be a leader, they have to experience this by being in a real situation of leading a team or a group, or even a situation. We can not be leaders by reading books or by listening to person talking about leading. Secondly, learning by doing things is more exciting than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about. There are a lot of things in life that should be learnt by doing them. Reading about things or listening to people talking about can rarely submit the same sensation or the same excitement to some one who wants to learn about the same thing. People who want to learn how to swim have to go to the beach or to the swimpool and laid themselves in the water to feel and know what is swimming. Nor listening to people or reading about can teach them swimming.Another reason that makes learning by doing things more advantageous than learning by reading about things or listening to people talking about is that we find more motivation to continuing on learning by doing things. With the time, Reading about things or listening to people talking about could become more and more boring. Learning by doing things gives us more and more pleasure especially if we success in learning perfectly this things. So we become motivated to learn other things by doing them.The history shows that learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things. People should not depend only on reading or listening to people talking about things to learn. They should try and keep trying until they learn what they want to learn.
llm: The pursuit of knowledge and skill development is a lifelong journey that requires dedication, perseverance, and a willingness to learn. People employ various methods to broaden their understanding and expertise, and one approach that I strongly advocate for is learning through hands-on experience. In my opinion, doing things by oneself is a more effective way to acquire knowledge and skills compared to merely reading about them or listening to others.Learning by doing things has numerous benefits, chief among them being the development of maturity. When we take on tasks and challenges independently, we are forced to rely on ourselves, which fosters self-reliance and autonomy. By doing things ourselves, we learn to navigate obstacles, make decisions, and take responsibility for our actions. This, in turn, builds confidence, resilience, and problem-solving skills, all of which are essential for personal and professional growth.Moreover, learning by doing things allows us to experience the practical applications of theoretical concepts, making them more tangible and memorable. When we engage in hands-on learning, we are able to see the immediate consequences of our actions, which helps to reinforce our understanding and retention of the material. Additionally, doing things ourselves enables us to develop a sense of ownership and pride in our accomplishments, which motivates us to continue learning and improving.In conclusion, learning by doing things is an invaluable approach to acquiring knowledge and skills. By taking an active, hands-on approach to learning, we develop maturity, self-reliance, and a deeper understanding of the subject matter. As such, I firmly believe that doing things by oneself is a superior method of learning, one that yields numerous benefits and sets the stage for a lifetime of personal and professional development.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: The advent of cheap air fares has revolutionized the way people travel, particularly for the lower income group. With affordable flight options, individuals who were previously unable to travel by air can now explore new destinations, both domestically and internationally. This has broadened travel possibilities for many, allowing them to experience different cultures, visit loved ones, and take breaks from their daily routines. The lower income group, in particular, has benefited greatly from this development, as they can now access modes of transportation that were once considered a luxury.However, the growing phenomenon of cheap flights has a darker side. The increased demand for air travel has led to a significant surge in air traffic, resulting in a substantial negative impact on the environment. One of the most pressing concerns is the emission of carbon dioxide from burning plane fuel. As airplanes take to the skies, they release massive amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, contributing to the greenhouse effect and causing the Earth to heat up. This, in turn, accelerates climate change, leading to devastating consequences such as rising sea levels, intense natural disasters, and unpredictable weather patterns.The environmental cost of cheap flights is a pressing issue that cannot be ignored. While the benefits of affordable air travel are undeniable, it is essential to acknowledge the harmful effects it has on our planet. As the world becomes increasingly interconnected, it is crucial to find a balance between accessibility and sustainability. Airlines, governments, and individuals must work together to mitigate the environmental impact of air travel, exploring alternatives such as electric or hybrid planes, and implementing measures to reduce carbon emissions. Only by acknowledging the negative consequences of cheap flights can we strive towards a more eco-friendly and responsible approach to air travel.

question: Should governments spend more money on improving roads and highways, or should governments spend more money on improving public transportation(buses, trains, subways)? Why?Ê
human: Many people think that governments should spend money on improving roads and highways while the others say that it would be better to spend money on public transportation. In my opinion, governments should certainly spend money on the public transportation system because it would deal with problems that the rising number of private cars is creating.First, the using of public transportation reduces the amount of resources using on transportation. Cars depend on gasoline, which is a non-renewable resource. Therefore, the more cars we use means that the faster gasoline in this world is used up. In the contrary, if the public transportation is efficiently used, the amount of gasoline consuming per person will be much lower. And this definitely helps to reserve our invaluable natural resource, gasoline.Second, public transportation helps to solve the air pollution problems. Averagely, public transports use much less gasoline to carry people than private cars. It means that by using public transports, the less gas exhaust is pumped to the air and people will no longer have to bear the stuffy situation on the roads, which is always full of fumes.Last but not least, using public transportation is much safer than private transportation. According to National Safety Council, riding the bus is over 170 times safer than private care. Thus there is no reason that governments should hesitate to invest in public transportation, a healthy, safe and economical way of transporting.In short, I can say for certain that spending money on improving public transportation is necessary because it is the key to protect our world, creating a healthy and safe environment for people to live in.
llm: The rapid increase in private car ownership has led to numerous problems that affect not only the environment but also the overall quality of life. To mitigate these issues, governments should prioritize investing in the public transportation system. This strategic allocation of funds would have multiple benefits, starting with the reduction of resource consumption on transportation. By providing efficient and reliable public transportation options, as an alternative to private vehicles, the overall demand for fuel and the subsequent depletion of natural resources can be significantly decreased.Another critical advantage of public transportation is its role in combating air pollution. The emissions from private cars contribute substantially to air pollution, which has severe health and environmental impacts. By encouraging the use of public transportation, as opposed to individual car travel, the amount of pollutants released into the atmosphere can be drastically reduced, leading to cleaner air and healthier living conditions for the population.Furthermore, opting for public transportation over private car use enhances safety on the roads. According to the National Safety Council, riding a bus is a staggering 170 times safer than traveling by private car. This significant difference in safety levels underscores the importance of public transportation in reducing accidents and ensuring the well-being of commuters. By investing in public transportation, governments can simultaneously address environmental concerns, reduce the consumption of limited resources, and most importantly, save lives by minimizing the risks associated with private car travel.In conclusion, the benefits of investing in public transportation are multifaceted and far-reaching. Not only does it contribute to a more sustainable use of resources and a reduction in air pollution, but it also plays a crucial role in enhancing road safety. Given these advantages, governments should indeed allocate funds to improve and expand public transportation systems, as this investment would yield significant returns in terms of environmental protection, resource conservation, and public safety.

question: Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer?
human: Everyone has their method to success in life. At school or university, success depends on how we study. Some students benefit a lot when they study with groups. Yet, I prefer to study individually because it helps me to concentrate more, and it helps me to build my personality.Studying alone helps us to focus more in our lessons. For instance, I am a type of person who cannot comprehend my subjects unless I am alone. I can prepare my schedules, guidelines, exercises and go over them all. Moreover, we have a lot of subjects which require us to sit and study alone such as math, reading, and drawing. In my opinion, I can take advantage of every minute without wasting by studying alone.Additionally, we are building our personalities when we study alone. For example, answering our homework alone encourages us to be more responsible and independent. Also, it motivates us to be accurate in our work in the future. Personally, when I fix my study plan with a specific time and finish it on time, it improves my ability in the future to become more precise and careful. To conclude, there are many ways to study and it is our right to choose which is suitable for our characters whether alone or with group. In fact, I agree with the idea of studying a lone since it helps me to focus more and establish my personality. Success needs us to work hard and sacrifice more whether we choose to study alone or with group.
llm: The debate about whether studying in groups or individually is more beneficial has been ongoing among students. While some students thrive in group study settings, claiming that it enhances their understanding and retention of material, I firmly believe that studying individually is more effective for me. The primary reason for this preference is that it allows me to concentrate more intensely on the subject matter at hand.When I study alone, I can focus my attention solely on the material, without distractions or interruptions from others. This enables me to grasp complex concepts more easily and to review the material at my own pace. In contrast, group study sessions can sometimes devolve into social gatherings, where the actual studying takes a backseat to conversation and camaraderie.Moreover, studying individually plays a significant role in shaping our personalities, particularly in terms of responsibility and independence. For instance, when I am tasked with completing my homework alone, I am compelled to take full ownership of the assignment. This sense of accountability encourages me to be more diligent and self-motivated, as I know that I alone am responsible for the quality of my work. By working independently, I develop essential life skills such as time management, self-discipline, and problem-solving, all of which are crucial for success not just in academics, but in professional and personal life as well.In conclusion, while group studying may offer benefits for some, I find that studying individually better suits my learning style and personal growth. It fosters a deeper understanding of the material, promotes concentration, and contributes to the development of vital personal traits like responsibility and independence. These skills, honed through solo study efforts, will undoubtedly serve as a strong foundation for my future academic and professional pursuits.

question: Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Whether human activity is making the Earth a better place to live or damaging it is a debatable issue. Some people advocate the idea that human activity is advantageously influencing to the Earth. However, I strongly believe that human activities are having a bad effect upon our planet, for human are polluting the Earth's environment, exhausting natural resource and threatening the living of other species.People are corrupting their ecosphere. In recent decades, concurrently with the increase of human consume, the waste discarded by human also multiplies. These wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. Furthermore, the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change.Besides, people are draining the Earth's natural resources. These resources such as oil, coal are vital for human activity, therefore nowadays, the exploitation activities of these resources are increasing dramatically to adapt to the infinite need of people. Researchers indicated that most of natural resources are un-recyclable and only several decades after, the Earth's natural resources are totally exhausted. At that time, human activity will be seriously affected due to the dependence on these resources.Also, people are endangering other species' live. Hunting has been a fundamental activity of human for having food. Through million years of hunting, especially in recent centuries with the innovation of rifle and dynamite, people have killed many animals and even have made some kinds of them become extinct. Moreover, people, suffering from the population pressure, are expanding their living area; consequently, the living area of other species narrowed. This narrowing of living region is pushing many creatures to the brink of extinction.All in all, from discussed reasons, we can conclude that human activity are gradually destroy the Earth since it is polluting the Earth environment, depleting the resource and imperiling other species' lives.
llm: The Earth's environment is facing a grave crisis due to human activities. People are polluting the planet at an alarming rate, releasing toxic chemicals and waste into the air, water, and soil. This not only harms the environment but also exhausts natural resources, threatening the very foundation of life on Earth. The depletion of natural resources such as oil, coal, and gas is a significant concern. These resources are being consumed at an unprecedented rate, with little regard for sustainability or conservation.The consequences of these actions are far-reaching and devastating. The pollution of the air, water, and soil is not only harming human health but also endangering the lives of other species. Many species are facing extinction due to habitat destruction, climate change, and pollution. The delicate balance of ecosystems is being disrupted, with potentially catastrophic consequences. The loss of biodiversity and the degradation of ecosystems will have severe and long-lasting impacts on the planet.It is imperative that we take immediate action to address these issues. We must adopt sustainable practices, such as reducing our reliance on fossil fuels, conserving water, and reducing waste. We must also protect and preserve natural habitats, and work to restore damaged ecosystems. Additionally, we must take steps to mitigate climate change, which is exacerbating the depletion of natural resources and the endangerment of other species. By working together, we can reduce our impact on the environment and ensure a healthy and thriving planet for future generations. It is our responsibility to act as stewards of the Earth and to protect the natural resources and species that call it home.

question: A company is going to give some money either to support the arts or protect the environment. Which do you think the company chooses? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: If I had the opportunity to help a company make a decision on spending money either on supporting the arts or helping the environment, I would choose the latter without hesitation for the reasons below. First, conservation is more urgent now than at any time in history. According to a statistic conducted by the International Animal Preserving Association, we have only ten percent of the animals that have ever existed, which means that the biodiversity of our home is grievously endangered. What's more, rising sea levels, caused by global warming, have reached a level that is threatening human's life in many countries. If we continue discharging carbon dioxide with non-environmentally friendly cars, nations like Japan will be submerged and weather patterns could change, causing flooding, drought, and an increasing amount of damaging storms. In short, the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever and if we didn't take harsh measures now, we never will.Furthermore, supporting environment protection will benefit the company eventually. Nowadays, an increasing amount of people pay more attention to conservation; therefore, sponsoring conservation is a more efficient method of advertising. Just imagine if the project your company is sponsoring effectively improves the environment, then your company would be known as an environmentally-friendly company and benefit from it in this consumer-oriented society.Finally, conservation leads us to a higher standard of living. I confess that art is one of the best ways of entertaining human beings, but, with exhaust fumes and acid rain, we do not have the energy and enthusiasm to appreciate the paintings or photographs. Biodiversity and a more beautiful nature are not only the results of abetter environment but also are the necessities of photography and other types of art.To sum up, although supporting art will benefit the human beings and the company in short-term interest, I still hold the environment protection for long-term interest.
llm: The state of our ecosystem has never been more precarious. The alarming rate of environmental degradation has brought us to a critical juncture, where immediate and drastic measures are necessary to mitigate the damage. If we fail to take decisive action now, the consequences will be catastrophic and irreversible. It is imperative that we prioritize environmental protection and make it a cornerstone of our collective efforts.One of the most effective ways to promote environmental protection is through advertising. By supporting eco-friendly initiatives and showcasing sustainable practices, companies can not only contribute to the preservation of our planet but also enhance their brand reputation. In fact, studies have shown that supporting environmental protection is a more efficient method of advertising, as it resonates with the growing demographic of environmentally conscious consumers. By embracing sustainability,Moreover, conservation efforts have a direct correlation with a higher standard of living. By preserving natural resources, as well as protecting biodiversity, we can ensure that future generations inherit a thriving and healthy environment. This, in turn, will lead to improved public health, In conclusion, the ecosystem is in its worst condition ever, and it is high time that we take responsibility for our actions and work towards a more sustainable future. By prioritizing environmental protection and conservation, we can create a better world for ourselves and future generations. It is our moral obligation to act now and make a positive impact on the planet. The time for procrastination is over, and the time for action is now.

question: We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (Someone you work closely with) ? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important.Ê
human: At work, you meet people with diverse backgrounds and you are required to maintain sound relationships with many of them in order to have a pleasant work environment. However, the relationship you need to maintain with your co-worker is the most important one since he or she is the person who works very closely with you, and in most instances you have to rely on him or her. Therefore in my view, a good co-worker needs to have three most important characteristics such as cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.The co-workers should be cooperative with one another. If they do not cooperate, there will be lots of disputes. I once had a co-worker who was too family conscious. Therefore he always left office sharp on time without giving any consideration whether the work has been finished or not. Most of the time, I had to do his work in order to protect him from getting caught to the supervisor who was a very authoritative person. However, one day I wanted to be off early because I had to take my mother to the doctor. When I requested my co-worker to give a helping hand to finish my work early, he turned down my request giving a silly excuse. From that day onwards I did not offer him any support and finally he was transferred from our department to a distant location as a punishment for his irresponsibility. Therefore, I believe if the co-workers do not corporate with each other that would be devastating in a work environment.The co-workers need to trust each other. They should not act on suspicion. This is a very important aspect in the work environment. I came across a situation once such that one of my subordinates used to suspect his co-worker for carrying tales to me. To a certain extent his suspicion was valid as his co-worker made several attempts to highlight the drawbacks of him. However I never encourage tale carriers as a principle and therefore his co-worker gave up talking ill against him with me. But this mistrust continued and created very unpleasant situations for everybody in my department. Finally, the co-workers should believe in fellowship. This helps them to enjoy their work life while building up very strong personal relationships. After all, you spend most of your day at office. If you have a good company in office, it is certainly a blessing.
llm: A good co-worker is an essential component of a successful and harmonious work environment. Among the numerous qualities that define a good co-worker, there are three most important characteristics that stand out: cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship. These traits are the foundation upon which positive and productive working relationships are built.First and foremost, cooperation is a vital characteristic of a good co-worker. When individuals cooperate, they work together towards a common goal, sharing their skills, knowledge, and ideas. This collaborative approach not only enhances the quality of work but also fosters a sense of unity and teamwork. On the other hand, if co-workers do not cooperate, it can lead to numerous disputes and conflicts, ultimately hindering the progress and success of the organization. Disputes can arise from misunderstandings, differences in opinion, and lack of communication, all of which can be mitigated by a cooperative attitude.Trustworthiness is another crucial characteristic of a good co-worker. When co-workers are trustworthy, they demonstrate reliability, integrity, and honesty in their interactions and work. This trait is essential for building strong working relationships, as it allows individuals to depend on each other and work together seamlessly. Trustworthiness also promotes a sense of security and stability, which is vital for a productive and efficient work environment.Lastly, fellowship is a characteristic that complements cooperation and trustworthiness. It refers to the sense of camaraderie and friendship that develops among co-workers. When co-workers exhibit fellowship, they demonstrate a willingness to support, encourage, and care for one another, both personally and professionally. This trait is essential for creating a positive and enjoyable work environment, where individuals feel valued, respected, and motivated to contribute their best. In conclusion, cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship are the three most important characteristics of a good co-worker. These traits are interdependent and collectively contribute to a harmonious, productive, and successful work environment.

question: Distance learning and online computer classes should replace classroom learning.
human: During these digital age, the online classes has become more interest and more common in the society. Almost every school develops their online class systems. One question I always thought about is whether online computer classes should replace classroom learning. Although, online classes have many advantages, for me, I prefer traditional learning classes for several reasons.First, the participant with the others like classmates or professors is still an important factor in studying. Working in group leads to more discussion and more opinion among the class. Consequently, the discussion class results in expanded children vision and their respect to others roommate's ideas. Unlike the distance learning that children have few opportunities to discuss with their friends.Second, classroom learning provides other activities than studying. During student's free time, they have a number of activities that they can join, such as playing sports, going to lab, or going to library. These activities lead to more interact with their friends. Connection with friends improves their IQ abilities, furthermore, they have a chance to learn about their societies. While the online course keeps the children at their home only.Lastly, in school, there are professors that guided you during you had a problem or needed an advice. The professor provides good answers to you. They do not mind helping you, and they never leave you alone when you got a problem. In contrast, in distance learning, these aspects of the professor had reduced their important. The professor has been assigned to teach only. Moreover, there will be a long response from the teachers when children ask them a question.In conclusion, traditional learning still has many benefits to the students. But in the future, it seems that the distance learning become more popular and ordinary in schools.
llm: The digital age has revolutionized the way we learn, with online classes becoming increasingly popular and common in society. As a result, the debate about whether online computer classes should replace traditional classroom learning has gained momentum. In my opinion, online classes have several advantages that make them an attractive alternative to traditional classroom learning.Firstly, online classes offer flexibility and convenience, allowing students to learn at their own pace and from any location. This is particularly beneficial for students who have work or family commitments, or those who live in remote areas with limited access to educational institutions. Online classes also provide access to a wide range of courses and resources that may not be available in traditional classroom settings.However, I do not think that online computer classes should completely replace classroom learning. Traditional classrooms provide a unique learning environment that fosters social interaction, human connection, and hands-on experience. Face-to-face interaction with instructors and peers is essential for developing important life skills such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving. Moreover, traditional classrooms provide a structured learning environment that helps students stay motivated and focused.In conclusion, while online computer classes have their advantages, I believe that they should complement traditional classroom learning rather than replace it. A blended learning approach that combines the flexibility of online classes with the social interaction and hands-on experience of traditional classrooms would be the most effective way to deliver education in the digital age. By leveraging the strengths of both online and traditional learning, we can create a more engaging, effective, and inclusive education system that prepares students for success in the 21st century.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: The issue at hand is whether it should be obligatory for university students to attend classes. This is an interesting question because it affects a great amount of students worldwide. Nonetheless there are various different policies regarding this topic. An important aspect might be whether one desires to optimize the learned knowledge or the amount of valuable experiences for the students. However, to my mind students should be free not to attend classes because it improves the quality of student life as well as their learning motivation and teaches important life skills.Firstly, a liberal policy is very feasible. Checking for attendance requires a lot of bureaucracy. Especially for larger classes it is impossible to check for everybody to attend. So an optional attendance saves time and money.Secondly, some students might learn better at home on their own, for instance, by reading the textbook. This problem occurs especially if the lecturer is lethargic. By letting students choose not to attend class you give them the opportunity to escape bad teaching. Thus they are able to save precious study time and dive into the course syllabus independently.In addition, being free to stay away from classes improves flexibility and therefore quality of student life. Sometimes the wild party on Thursday night is too good to end already at midnight only because of a lecture on Friday in the morning. With a liberal policy students are able to postpone the learning to the afternoon which gives a feeling of freedom and improves time efficiency. Research has shown that the more satisfied the students are with those life aspects, the better they perform in academic areas.Finally, psychology knows two types of motivation. There is intrinsic motivation which comes from your own mindset. And there is extrinsic motivation which comes from the praise and laud of other people. Intrinsic motivation is known to be much more desirable because it leads to better learning and well-being. However, in order to gain intrinsic motivation students need to become aware of their strengths and aims. By giving students the freedom to choose about class attendance they might rather be thinking about why they decided to study and learn to motivate themselves. These are crucial skills for the duration of their study and their whole life time.To conclude, it is clear that going to classes should be optional for students. I hold this belief due to the improvement of students' current experience as well as the valuable skills and knowledge they obtain for their whole life afterwards.
llm: The notion that students should be free not to attend classes may seem unconventional, but it has numerous benefits that can enhance the overall quality of student life, learning motivation, and the acquisition of essential life skills. By allowing students the autonomy to decide when to attend classes, educational institutions can foster a more mature and self-directed approach to learning.Firstly, this freedom improves the quality of student life by reducing unnecessary stress and pressure associated with mandatory attendance. When students are not forced to attend every class, they can manage their time more effectively, prioritize their well-being, and balance academic responsibilities with personal interests. This flexibility can lead to better mental health, as students are able to take breaks when needed, thereby avoiding burnout.Secondly, the freedom not to attend classes can boost learning motivation. When students are given the choice, they are more likely to attend classes that genuinely interest them, leading to a more engaged and motivated learning experience. This autonomy can help students develop a sense of responsibility and ownership over their learning process, which is crucial for sustained motivation and academic success.Moreover, being free to stay away from classes teaches important life skills such as time management, prioritization, and self-discipline. In the real world, individuals are not always mandated to be in a specific place at a specific time unless absolutely necessary. Thus, learning to manage one’s time effectively and make responsible decisions about attendance is a valuable skill that prepares students for their future careers and personal lives.Lastly, this approach improves flexibility, allowing students to adapt their schedules according to their needs, whether academic, personal, or professional. In a rapidly changing world, the ability to be flexible and adapt quickly is a significant advantage, and educational systems should reflect this reality.In conclusion, giving students the freedom not to attend classes can have a profoundly positive impact on their academic journey, personal development, and future readiness. It is an approach that recognizes the importance of autonomy, self-motivation, and the development of critical life skills, all of which are essential for success in an ever-evolving world.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
human: Place of living has the most significant affect on our lives and we have to choose it according to several factors. Some people prefer to live in tall buildings and crowded areas, whereas others prefer to live in a small and calm town. I would prefer to live in a small town and I think a small town has some advantages, such as good weather, a healthy life and better facilities.Firstly, the first advantage of living in a small town is a healthy life that we can obtain due to many items. One of the conditions that helps us to be healthy is good weather and less population that exist in a small town. Also, in a small town there are less crowded and less traffic. Living in a place with less pollution such as air pollution or sound pollution helps us to have a healthier life and one of the main consequences is less stress and more happiness. Moreover, in a small town foods and materials we need are healthier than in big cities and there are fresh foods and fruits. Regardless of some exceptions, it is obvious that living in small towns is healthier than in big cities.Secondly, another advantage of small towns is living costs. Living cost is one of the important concerns in every society and then, in a small town living cost is fewer than in big cities. Therefore, in a small town we can live in big houses with good landscapes, also because of less crowded spaces we have more facilities and more services. Transportation cost is less than in big cities and we have less traffic so that we can save time and money.In conclusion, I prefer to live in a small town and I think it has some advantages such as less stress, because of better weather conditions and also, better relationship within a town. In small town people know each other and have better deal together than big cities therefore on big cities people feel alone and depress more than small cities. However it is an obvious fact that people in small town have more happiness and friendship and less illness and stress.
llm: As the world becomes increasingly urbanized, I find myself gravitating towards the charm of small towns. The idea of living in a close-knit community, surrounded by natural beauty and a slower pace of life, is highly appealing to me. One of the primary advantages of small towns is the desirable quality of life they offer. The weather is often more pleasant, and the air is fresher, allowing for a healthier lifestyle. Additionally, small towns often boast better facilities, such as parks, community centers, and local shops, which foster a sense of community and provide ample opportunities for socialization and recreation.Another significant advantage of small towns is the lower cost of living. In today's society, living costs are a major concern for many individuals, and small towns offer a more affordable alternative to big cities. The cost of housing, food, and transportation is significantly lower, making it easier for people to make ends meet. Moreover, the close relationships and strong social bonds that form in small towns often lead to better deals and more favorable prices among community members. In contrast, big cities can be overwhelming and isolating, leaving people feeling alone and disconnected from those around them.In small towns, people are more likely to know and interact with their neighbors, fostering a sense of belonging and cooperation. This camaraderie is often absent in big cities, where anonymity and disconnection can prevail. Overall, I firmly believe that small towns offer a unique and desirable way of life, characterized by good weather, healthy living, better facilities, and lower living costs. The strong social bonds and sense of community that define small towns make them an attractive option for those seeking a more relaxed, affordable, and connected lifestyle.

question: In many countries, young people leave rural areas to study or work in cities. What do you think are reason of this? Do you think the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
human: These days, there are increasing numbers of young people from the countryside moving to cities in search of jobs and educational opportunities. Personally, I think it has some drawbacks that will be discussed in this essay together with some reasons about this.To begin with, the major cause that leads to urban migration of young adults is that cities often offer more well-paid jobs and study chances compared to rural areas. Obviously, many large companies and universities often locate in cities which are hailed as promising lands to develop their career. Therefore they move to big cities to pursue academic career and find jobs in order to have a higher standard of living. For example, if a gradate stays in the city after leaving his college and seeks a job with good salary instead of returning his village to do farm work, he could perhaps buy a house or his own car after a short time. However, this phenomenon sometimes poses several negative consequences. There can be no doubt that the burgeoning number of young adults from the countryside flocking to cities gives rise to overpopulation in cities. As a result, cities cannot provide adequate space for thousands of dwellers that might lead to poor housing conditions and sanitation. Additionally, it might put strain on the environment. If there are more people in the cities, there would be large numbers of vehicles on the road, which causes air pollution.In conclusion, young people tend to study or work in urban areas since these provide them many educational opportunities and career potentials. In my opinion, however, I do not approve of this trend due to negative effects such as low quality of life and affecting the environment.
llm: The migration of young people from rural areas to urban centers has become a prevalent phenomenon in recent years. Driven by the pursuit of better job prospects and access to quality education, this trend has been gaining momentum. However, I strongly disapprove of this trend due to its far-reaching negative consequences.One of the primary concerns is the significant decline in the quality of life for these young migrants. Upon arriving in cities, they often find themselves struggling to adapt to the fast-paced and competitive environment. The high cost of living, coupled with the scarcity of affordable housing, forces many to live in overcrowded and unsanitary conditions. This not only takes a toll on their physical health but also leads to increased stress levels and decreased overall well-being.Furthermore, the influx of people into cities has devastating effects on the environment. The rapid urbanization resulting from this migration leads to increased air and water pollution, as well as the destruction of natural habitats. The strain on already overburdened city infrastructure, such as transportation and waste management systems, exacerbates the problem. As a result, the environment suffers, and the quality of life for all city residents is compromised.In conclusion, while the intention behind the migration of young people from rural areas to cities is understandable, the negative repercussions cannot be overlooked. It is essential for governments and policymakers to address the root causes of this trend, such as lack of opportunities and resources in rural areas, and work towards creating a more balanced and sustainable development across all regions. By doing so, we can mitigate the adverse effects of urbanization and ensure a better quality of life for all individuals, regardless of their geographical location.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. High school students should take a course on basic economics
human: In today's community, economy becomes the order of the day. Getting to know the theory in this area seems really important for our students. Then, the earlier we jump into this area, the more skillful we will be. Thus, in my point of view, although it will take some time on it, high school students should take a course on basic economics. Let me explain it in detail.For the primary concern, it can provide students a sense of direction in academy. Basic economic class can help the students touch the surface of this field, let them to know what this subject mainly discuss. That will help the students cultivate their own interest and a sense of career orientation. Finally, students may study harder for their economic dreams. On the other hand, economy is always correlate with politics, students can study specialized knowledge along with some Politian status, which may open their vision toward the nation and don't get limited in the textbooks. Besides, there is also an intimate connection between economy and enterprises, students can also gain knowledge more practical and vivid.In addition, the basic economic course can also help with the students when they go to college. They may feel more readily to learn the knowledge in this field and save much time, with that they are able to study more efficiently and more deeply than other students. That as well would provide the students with more confidence and let them become more compatible.Considering all those factors above, I suggest the basic course of economic is necessary.
llm: In today's fast-paced community, the economy has become the order of the day. It is an undeniable fact that economic knowledge and skills are essential for individuals to navigate and succeed in the modern world. As such, it is crucial for individuals to jump into the field of economics as early as possible. The earlier one starts, the more skillful and adept they will become in handling economic concepts, theories, and practices.By introducing economics at a young age, individuals can develop a strong foundation in financial literacy, budgeting, and investing. This, in turn, enables them to make informed decisions about their financial resources, leading to a more stable and secure future. Moreover, having a head start in economics can also give individuals a competitive edge in the job market, as they will be better equipped to understand and analyze economic trends, patterns, and fluctuations.Furthermore, taking basic economic courses can also prove to be beneficial for students when they attend college. Many colleges and universities offer economics as a major or minor, and having prior knowledge of economic principles can give students a significant advantage. They will be able to build upon their existing knowledge, explore advanced economic concepts, and develop specialized skills in areas such as microeconomics, macroeconomics, or international trade. This, in turn, can lead to better academic performance, increased confidence, and enhanced career prospects.In conclusion, it is evident that gaining an early understanding of economics is vital in today's community. By acquiring economic knowledge and skills from an early age, individuals can set themselves up for success, make informed financial decisions, and gain a competitive edge in the job market. Additionally, basic economic courses can provide a solid foundation for students to excel in college, paving the way for a brighter and more prosperous future.

question: University education should be restricted to the very best academic students, rather than being available to a large proportion of young people. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Universtiy is an entrance to life. It equips us with a package of wisdom and virtue to succeed. It is the importance of university that raises a question whether students with best scholastic performance deserve university study or just any young wishful people. Both sides are to be discussed before a conclusion is reached.To begin with, outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. To be precise, such abstract or complicated informatin, easily absorbed by those students, may prove as a matter of pressure for those who lack equivalent skills. Besides, it is undeniable that one deserves what he has done. University is like a gift presented to those who have gone to great length to attain.However, university is not just about academic studies but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Therefore, it should be up for grabs for a majority of young people, who wish to pursue their passion as well as develop comprehensively. What is more, there is a tendency for social vices to rise if university is to be restricted to only the best people. Apart from the disheartened ones, many devoiding of neccessary preparations are likely to be recipes for failure when applying for jobs, mostly the white-collar ones.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. In my opinion, it will yield more negative results than positive ones. That's why it should be made available for a wide range of learners.
llm: The debate about university eligibility has sparked a heated discussion in recent years. On one hand, it is argued that outstanding academic students are eligible for university due to their intellectual advantage. This is because these students have demonstrated exceptional academic prowess, which is often seen as a prerequisite for university admission. Their intellectual capacity enables them to excel in academic studies, thereby making them ideal candidates for higher education.However, university is not just about academic studies, but also a place to nurture artistic talent and develop soft skills. Many students who may not excel academically may possess exceptional artistic or creative abilities that can be honed and refined at the university level. Furthermore, university provides a platform for students to develop essential soft skills such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving, which are vital in the real world. By restricting university admission to only academically gifted students, the potential of these creatively inclined students may be stifled.In conclusion, university restriction has both pros and cons. On the one hand, restricting admission to outstanding academic students ensures that only those who are intellectually prepared for the rigors of university studies are admitted. This can lead to a more focused and productive academic environment. On the other hand, such restrictions may deny talented individuals who do not fit the traditional academic mold the opportunity to develop their skills and reach their full potential. Ultimately, a balanced approach that considers both academic achievement and other forms of talent and ability is necessary to create a holistic and inclusive university environment. By doing so, we can foster a diverse and dynamic community that values and nurtures all forms of excellence.

question: Prevention is better than cure. Out of a country's health budget, a large proportion should be diverted from treatment to spending on health education and preventative measures. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: In today's world, the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens. I completely agree with the idea that governments should devote a greater portion of their health budgets to health education and means for precautions.The first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. I believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. Therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.The second reason why governments should allocate more budget on prevention from illness and providing health education is the welfare of the society. In my opinion, there is nothing more important than health in a human's life and the happiness and welfare come with health. Therefore, a government's role should be providing means that lead its citizens to learn how to prevent from potential illness that can cause misery in people's lives. For example, the marketing campaign of Ministry of Health in Turkey which aimed smoking problem among the youth increased the well-being of those who quit smoking and adapted a better lifestyle after the campaign.In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment due to achieve more effective health system and greater level of well-being.
llm: In today's world, the concept of the welfare state has evolved to encompass a wide range of responsibilities, with a significant emphasis on healthcare and health education. Governments are no longer just providers of basic necessities, but are also expected to ensure the well-being and health of their citizens. This includes providing sustainable healthcare systems, as well as health education to promote preventive care and healthy lifestyles.The importance of healthcare and health education cannot be overstated. A healthy population is more productive, contributing to the overall economic growth and development of a country. Furthermore, a well-informed population is better equipped to make healthy choices, reducing the burden on healthcare systems. However, the current allocation of resources often prioritizes treatment over prevention and education. This approach is not only costly but also less effective in the long run.A more sustainable and efficient approach would be to allocate a greater proportion of the budget to education and prevention issues. By investing in health education, governments can empower citizens with the knowledge to make informed decisions about their health. Preventive measures such as vaccinations, screenings, and healthy lifestyle promotions can significantly reduce the incidence of diseases, thereby decreasing the need for costly treatments. This proactive approach not only improves health outcomes but also reduces the financial strain on healthcare systems.In conclusion, a greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issues in comparison with treatment. This strategic allocation of resources will lead to a healthier, more informed population, and ultimately, a more sustainable healthcare system. By prioritizing prevention and education, governments can fulfill their role in the welfare state more effectively, contributing to the overall well-being and prosperity of their citizens. This forward-thinking approach is essential for building resilient and healthy communities, capable of thriving in today's challenging world.

question: With the pressures on todayÕs young people to succeed academically, some people believe that non-academic subjects at school (eg: physical education and cookery should be removed from the syllabus so that children can concentrate wholly on academic subjects. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Students have become more and more stressed during the last few years due to the increase in academic tasks assigned by their teachers to improve their academic success. While some people believe that non-academic subjects should be completely removed, I strongly disagree with that.To begin with, from the health point of view, schools should not only deliver academic subjects. If physical education is removed from the syllabus, there will be considerable negative effects on students’ health. For instance, after studying and sitting in the classroom for the whole morning, it is better for students to do some outdoor activities, such as stretching, jogging and playing ball games, in order to improve their learning ability during the afternoon classes.
