By being aware of the power of their words and actions, parents can harness their influence to raise confident, capable, and compassionate individuals who will thrive in all aspects of life.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The development of modern food technology has revolutionized the way we prepare and consume food. With the advancement of industrial food production, meals can be prepared more easily and efficiently than ever before. The use of preservatives, additives, and other chemicals has enabled mass production of food products, making them widely available and affordable. As a result, food can be prepared in a fraction of the time it used to take, and it can also taste a lot better than it used to, with a wider range of flavors and textures available.However, this convenience comes with a caveat. People should be careful with what they eat, as some industrial foods are very bad for their health. The high levels of salt, sugar, and unhealthy fats present in many processed foods can lead to a range of health problems, including obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Furthermore, the use of artificial additives and preservatives has been linked to various health issues, such as allergies and digestive problems. Therefore, it is essential for consumers to be mindful of the ingredients and nutritional content of the food they eat.In conclusion, while the development of modern food technology has made food preparation easier and more convenient, it is crucial for people to be aware of the potential health risks associated with industrial foods. By making informed choices about the food they eat, individuals can enjoy the benefits of modern food technology while also protecting their health. This can be achieved by opting for whole, unprocessed foods, reading food labels carefully, and being cautious of foods that are high in unhealthy ingredients. By being mindful of what we eat, we can ensure that the convenience of modern food technology does not come at the cost of our health.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The debate on whether schools should require students to take regular standardized exams has been ongoing for years. One of the primary arguments in favor of these exams is that they provide a fair and unbiased means of grading students. Standardized tests offer a level playing field, where all students are assessed based on the same criteria, allowing teachers to accurately evaluate their knowledge and understanding of the subject matter.Moreover, many teachers rely heavily on exam results when grading their students. This is because exams provide a comprehensive and objective measure of a student's performance, making it easier for teachers to compare and contrast their students' abilities. By using exam results as a primary grading tool, teachers can ensure that their assessments are fair, consistent, and free from personal biases. This approach is particularly useful in large classrooms where it may be challenging for teachers to get to know each student individually and assess their progress accurately.The use of standardized exams is superior to other assessment methods because it provides a clear and transparent way of evaluating student performance. Unlike other forms of assessment, such as classwork or projects, which can be subjective and influenced by various factors, exams offer a straightforward and quantifiable measure of a student's knowledge and skills. Additionally, exams help teachers to identify areas where students may need extra support or review, allowing them to tailor their instruction to meet the needs of their students. In conclusion, requiring students to take regular standardized exams is a sensible approach, as it enables teachers to fairly and accurately grade their students, and provides a reliable means of assessing student performance.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: In today's world, the cost of education is skyrocketing, making it increasingly difficult for individuals to pursue their academic goals. As a result, many people are opting for self-financed education, where they bear the entire cost of their education. However, the idea of free-of-charge education is a beacon of hope for scholars who are genuinely passionate about learning and willing to put in the effort required to succeed.The rising cost of education is a significant barrier for many individuals, particularly those from low-income backgrounds. Self-financed education, while providing an opportunity for individuals to pursue their academic goals, can lead to a significant financial burden. Many students are forced to take out loans or work part-time jobs to support themselves, which can be stressful and distracting from their studies.On the other hand, the concept of free-of-charge education is a game-changer. It inspires and motivates scholars who are truly dedicated to their studies, as they are able to focus solely on their academic pursuits without the burden of financial worries. Free education allows students to explore their interests and passions without the pressure of having to justify the cost of their education. It also provides an equal opportunity for all individuals to access quality education, regardless of their financial background.Moreover, free education can lead to a more equitable and just society, where individuals are judged on their merit and abilities rather than their financial resources. It can also lead to a more skilled and educated workforce, which can have a positive impact on the economy and society as a whole. In conclusion, while self-financed education may be a necessity for some, the idea of free-of-charge education is a powerful motivator for scholars who are genuinely committed to their studies, and it has the potential to create a more just and equitable society.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: The role of professors in a university is multifaceted, with teaching and research being two of the most critical aspects of their job. While it is undeniable that professors are essentially teachers who play a vital role in educating students, it is equally important to acknowledge the significance of research in their profession. In fact, I firmly believe that professors should allocate more time to conducting research rather than solely focusing on teaching.There are several compelling reasons to support this argument. Firstly, research is essential for advancing knowledge and innovation in various fields, and professors are best positioned to drive this process. By dedicating more time to research, professors can contribute to the discovery of new ideas, theories, and technologies that can have a profound impact on society. This, in turn, can enhance the reputation of the university and attract more talented students and faculty members.Secondly, research experience is invaluable for professors as it enables them to stay updated with the latest developments in their field and incorporate this knowledge into their teaching. This can lead to more engaging and relevant coursework, which can inspire students to pursue their own research interests. Moreover, professors who are actively involved in research can serve as role models and mentors, motivating students to adopt a similar approach to learning and exploration.Lastly, prioritizing research can lead to more collaboration and networking opportunities for professors, which can result in access to more resources, funding, and expertise. This can further amplify the impact of their research and create a positive feedback loop, where research informs teaching, and teaching inspires research. In conclusion, while teaching is undoubtedly a crucial aspect of a professor's role, it is essential to recognize the significance of research and allocate sufficient time to pursue it. By doing so, professors can drive innovation, enhance their teaching, and contribute to the advancement of knowledge in their field.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The impact of television and movies on people's behavior is a widely debated topic. While some argue that these media outlets can have a positive influence, it is undeniable that their negative effects far outweigh the good. The truth is, television and movies often have a detrimental influence on our behavior, shaping our habits and interactions in unhealthy ways.One of the most significant negative effects of television and movies is their promotion of unhealthy eating habits. The constant advertisements and portrayals of junk food in these media outlets encourage people to consume more rubbish food, leading to a rise in obesity and other diet-related health issues. Furthermore, the excessive screen time spent watching television or movies can lead to a sedentary lifestyle, causing individuals to spend less time engaging in physical activities and socializing with friends and family.Moreover, television and movies often present unrealistic and superficial role models, promoting materialism and consumerism. People, especially young viewers, may feel pressured to conform to these idealized images, leading to a loss of individuality and authenticity. They may try to emulate the characters they see on screen, rather than being themselves, resulting in a lack of self-confidence and self-acceptance. This can have long-term effects on mental health and relationships, as people struggle to maintain a sense of identity and belonging.In conclusion, while television and movies can have some positive influences, their negative effects on behavior are more pronounced. They contribute to unhealthy eating habits, social isolation, and a loss of individuality. It is essential for viewers to be aware of these influences and to consume media responsibly, promoting a healthier and more balanced lifestyle. By being mindful of the media's impact, we can mitigate its negative effects and foster a more positive and authentic sense of self.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: Visiting museums is an enriching experience that offers a multitude of benefits. Not only do museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of a place, but they also serve as a platform for socialization. By exploring the various exhibits and displays, the visitor can gain a deeper understanding of the local heritage and traditions. The wealth of knowledge acquired through museum visits enables individuals to participate in conversations with a newfound confidence, armed with fascinating facts and insights.Moreover, museums present a unique opportunity for making friends and establishing relations with like-minded people. As visitors wander through the galleries, they can engage with others who share similar interests, striking up conversations and fostering connections. These interactions can lead to meaningful relationships, both personal and professional. The shared experience of discovering new artifacts and learning about historical events creates a common ground, allowing individuals to bond over their mutual curiosity.The knowledge gained from museum visits can also be applied in various aspects of life, enabling individuals to engage in discussions with a broader perspective. By being well-informed about different cultures and historical events, individuals can navigate social situations with greater ease, contributing to a more harmonious and enlightened community. In conclusion, visiting museums is a rewarding experience that not only expands one's knowledge but also provides a chance to form new connections and participate in conversations with confidence. As such, the importance of museums as a hub for both intellectual and social growth cannot be overstated. By embracing the opportunities that museums offer, individuals can enrich their lives and the lives of those around them.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: The age-old adage that "a man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues" still holds true today. A person's mannerisms and behavior towards others can reveal a great deal about their character and values. Those who possess good manners are likely to give others a fine personal impression, A person with good manners is one who is polite, courteous, and respectful towards others. They are able to express themselves in a way that is considerate and thoughtful, making those around them feel valued and appreciated. Politeness and tender words have a profound impact on both the speaker and the listener. Not only do they help the speaker to earn a good reputation and build strong relationships, But they also have the power to encourage and uplift those who are in need. A kind word or a gentle gesture can go a long way in brightening someone's day and boosting their confidence. In times of hardship or struggle, a person with good manners can offer comfort and support through their thoughtful and empathetic demeanor.In conclusion, good manners are essential for building strong relationships and earning the respect and admiration of others. By being polite, courteous, and respectful, we can create a positive and supportive environment that benefits everyone involved. As the saying goes, "a man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues," and it is up to each of us to ensure that our manners reflect the best of our character. By doing so, we can make a lasting and positive impact on those around us and create a more harmonious and compassionate world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: The notion that difficulties encountered at a young age can become an invaluable fortune in the future is a concept that has garnered significant attention. From my perspective, I wholeheartedly agree with this statement, believing that tough experiences in early life can indeed be beneficial in one's life journey.To begin with, hardship has a profound impact on an individual's ability to appreciate the small, yet wonderful things in life. When people face challenges from a young age, they develop a deeper understanding of the value of everyday moments and experiences. This realization fosters a sense of gratitude and contentment, allowing them to cherish the common yet wonderful little things that happen in their lives. As a result, they become more optimistic and resilient, leading to a more fulfilling life.Moreover, individuals who have experienced numerous difficulties tend to remain calm in the face of trouble. Having already overcome significant obstacles, they possess a heightened sense of awareness and confidence in their ability to navigate challenges. This composure enables them to approach problems with a clear and level head, making more informed decisions and finding solutions more efficiently. Their past experiences serve as a foundation for their future, providing them with the strength and perseverance needed to overcome any obstacle that comes their way.In conclusion, the difficulties people encounter at a young age can indeed become a valuable asset in their future lives. By teaching individuals to appreciate the small things and remain calm in the face of adversity, these challenges lay the groundwork for a stronger, more resilient person. As such, I firmly believe that the tough experiences people meet before will ultimately be helpful in their life path, shaping them into capable and determined individuals.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport. The buses and trains are more frequent than in the countryside, so the city provides better communication.However, in the countryside there are many places to rest, because of its location. Moreover, peaceful and close to the nature areas could help to avoid worries and sadness.Taking all into account, I think that living in the city is much better nowadays, because of the opportunities it gives. Today living in the rural places is in most causes connected with agrarian lifestyle, which for me is without perspective. If I could decide I would chose living in the city for sure.
llm: The debate about the advantages of living in the city versus the countryside has been ongoing for years. While both options have their pros and cons, the city seems to offer a more attractive and convenient lifestyle. One of the main advantages of living in the city is the better education system and more work opportunities. Cities are typically home to prestigious universities and a wide range of industries, providing citizens with access to quality education and employment.Another benefit of urban living is the cultural diversity that comes with a large and populous city. With more citizens from various backgrounds, cities offer a unique blend of cultures, making them a melting pot of traditions, customs, and ways of life. This diversity is reflected in the city's cuisine, festivals, and art, making it a fascinating place to live and experience. Furthermore, cities have a well-developed transportation system, with frequent buses and trains, making it easy to get around and communicate with others.On the other hand, the countryside has its own charm and advantages. One of the most significant benefits of rural living is the abundance of peaceful and serene locations, perfect for rest and relaxation. The countryside's natural beauty, rolling hills, and quiet atmosphere make it an ideal destination for those seeking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. However, when weighing the pros and cons, the city's advantages in terms of education, job opportunities, cultural diversity, and communication seem to outweigh the benefits of rural living. Overall, the city provides a more dynamic and convenient lifestyle, making it a more attractive option for those seeking to advance their careers, experience new cultures, and enjoy a faster pace of life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Your job has more effect on your happiness than your living environment does.
human: With the development of the economy, people become more and more rich. They start to pay attention to mental requirement like happiness. While I accept that job can offer happiness to some people, I believe that living environment is more important than job for most of us.Admittedly, job can bring us happiness. People can receive a sense of values and respected from job. If people receive respect from others, they will feel achievement and self-confidence. In addition, job can provide money to us. However, people should concern more about their living environment than job. First, for most of us, job is only a tool to maintain our lives. Few people can feel happiness from their job because they have to continue to work more than 30 years. For example, Workers in the FOXCONN factory, which is the main manufacture of APPLE Company, just repeat one action more than 8 hours every day. These labor works cannot provide workers with a lot of happiness because they feel tired and frustrated after long hour work. Second, beautiful environment is one of basic physiological needs, which are the most fundamental requirements for people. Without beautiful environment, people are not able to feel happiness and will fell anxiety. Nowadays, the fast development of economy is gradually destroying our environment very quickly. Factories released a huge amount of wasters into river and soil. In order to build city and factory, people destroy huge forests. In China, some residents who live in nearby some toxic factories became sick because these factories release a lot of toxic water and wasters into environment around people. Even though local residents benefits from an increasing number of jobs which are provided by those factories, they cannot feel happiness from high-paying job yet because most of them suffer from cancer or other diseases.In conclusion, it is far better to protect our living environment rather than focus on job or work since the goal people is for good livers.
llm: As the world's economy continues to grow, people are becoming increasingly wealthy. With their basic needs met, they are now focusing on fulfilling their mental requirements, such as the pursuit of happiness. While some individuals may find happiness in their jobs, I firmly believe that a person's living environment plays a more significant role in determining their overall happiness.For many people, their job is just a means to a paycheck, and it may not necessarily bring them joy or fulfillment. On the other hand, a person's living environment has a profound impact on their daily life and overall well-being. A comfortable, safe, and beautiful living space can greatly contribute to one's happiness and sense of satisfaction. The quality of air, access to green spaces, and proximity to amenities such as parks, schools, and healthcare facilities are just a few examples of how a living environment can shape a person's happiness.Moreover, a person's living environment can also influence their mental health, social connections, and overall quality of life. For instance, a living environment that is polluted, noisy, or crowded can lead to increased stress levels, anxiety, and depression. In contrast, a peaceful, natural, and vibrant living environment can foster a sense of calmness, creativity, and community, ultimately leading to greater happiness. Therefore, while a job may provide a sense of purpose and fulfillment for some, I believe that a person's living environment is more crucial in determining their overall happiness and well-being. As people continue to prioritize their mental requirements, it is essential to recognize the significance of living environment in achieving happiness and a better quality of life.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail and voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer?
human: Technology has been developing so quickly and becoming more perfect every day. Communication nowadays depends on technology pretty much. Voice mail, e-mail, telephone or just traditional way: face-to-face. However, I prefer e-mail due to 3 reasons: convenience, honest expression and fluency in communicating.Everyone agrees that e-mail has been a great way of communication. You can talk to others from thousands mile. For instance, if you are in Vietnam and another person is in the US - half of the Earth, no matter how far it is, you can keep contact. We will never have to worry if our mails will be sent to the right address. If the address is wrong, then you will know right away. Moreover, e-mail doesn't take too much time: just a click.In addition, writing e-mail helps people express honestly. Some people think that the face-to-face conversations make them feel stupid. Sometimes, their ideas are not expressed as exactly as they expect. For instance, I want to talk to my friend about a ticklish problem like her behavior, it's hard for me to face her and explain what she should do. Therefore, e-mail will be a good tool to help me speak out. She will just read my e-mail instead of listening to my voice which can make her annoyed. I don't have to worry about any other thing can make my opinion become unpersuasive.Last but not least, every communication needs fluency so people can understand each other exactly and remember it for a long time. Voice email or face-to-face conversations sometimes make reserve people feel not very confident. For example, when I face my parents, I can't speak out every idea and express consecutively. They may stop me, speak something against it and that makes me forget what I want to say. Anyone can meet this problem once in any conversation. E-mail helps me arrange my idea perfectly and make it persuasive. On the whole, to compare to all ways of communication, I really think that e-mail is the greatest way for major people to use. Its convenience saves our time. Additionally, honesty is necessary for every conversation and also fluency can't be missing for a persuasive expression.
llm: The advent of technology has revolutionized the way we communicate, offering a multitude of options for staying in touch with others. Gone are the days of relying solely on traditional face-to-face interactions. Nowadays, we have a plethora of choices, including voice mail, e-mail, telephone, and of course, the classic in-person conversation. Among these options, I firmly believe that email stands out as the most preferable method of communication, and for good reason.First and foremost, email offers unparalleled convenience. With the ability to send and receive messages at any time and from any location, email accommodates even the most hectic of schedules. Unlike traditional face-to-face conversations or even phone calls, which demand immediate attention and can be intrusive, email allows the recipient to respond at their leisure. This flexibility is invaluable in today's fast-paced world.Another significant advantage of email is that it facilitates honest expression. When communicating through email, individuals have the time to gather their thoughts, reflect on their feelings, and articulate their messages with clarity and precision. This often leads to more sincere and thoughtful interactions, as opposed to the potential for miscommunication that can occur in the spontaneity of face-to-face conversations or over the phone.Lastly, email enables fluency in communicating, especially across different languages and geographical boundaries. With the aid of translation tools and the lack of real-time pressure, email breaks down barriers that might otherwise hinder effective communication. It allows for the exchange of ideas, sentiments, and information in a clear, composed manner, fostering deeper understanding and connection among individuals.In conclusion, while the traditional face-to-face method will always hold a special place in human interaction, the benefits of email, including its convenience, the honesty it encourages, and the fluency it provides, make it my preferred mode of communication in today's tech-driven world. Whether for personal, academic, or professional purposes, email has proven to be a reliable, efficient, and effective means of staying connected.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There are many interesting programs on television which anyone can enjoy at little cost. Compared to other hobbies such as going to theater or going to sports stadium, it is a very cost-effective hobby that gives viewer quiet a few indirect experiences. However, from my point of view, television has more bad than good because it has made people not to have conversation each other.To begin with, television shows make people forget what is really important. One who has favorite programs tends to be obessed with them when they are on air. Thus, they cannot make appointment or go out with their family or friends at that time since they think the programs are so crucial to their lives. One of my friends, for example, once cancelled an appointment to play basketball with in order to watch the favorite television show "Infinete Challenges". This is not only about basketball, but also about our friendship, which depends on how often we meet and have a chance to talk to each other. That is, watching television alone at home, my friend lost the opportunity to increase cohesion between us.Moreover, even when people watch television together, there is no chance for them to have conversation in front of television. Watching television program together is not that different from watching same program alone. Thus, it is not good for them to watch television if they want to improve their sense of closeness. To illustrate my point, it is reported that most of people don't converse with their family when they are watching television together. It is natural they behave in that way because television shows don't require any participation.In conclusion, I firmly believe that it is detrimental to communication among members in group, family or friends or whatever, to sit in front of television and just stare forward. It is because television not only makes people be obsessed with it but also makes their mouth close.
llm: The advent of television has brought about a myriad of effects on individuals and society as a whole. While it may have its advantages, such as providing entertainment and information, the negatives associated with it far outweigh the positives. One of the most significant drawbacks of television is its tendency to discourage face-to-face conversation among people.In today's world, it is not uncommon to find families or friends gathered in the same room, yet each individual is glued to the screen, oblivious to the presence of others. This phenomenon has led to a decline in meaningful conversations and interactions, which are essential for building and maintaining relationships. As people spend more time watching television, they tend to neglect the importance of engaging with one another, leading to a sense of isolation and disconnection.Furthermore, television shows often distract people from what is truly important in life. With the constant stream of programs and advertisements, individuals can easily become sidetracked from their priorities and goals. The glamorization of material possessions and unrealistic lifestyles portrayed on television can also create unrealistic expectations and promote consumerism. As a result, people may find themselves striving for things that do not truly matter, rather than focusing on personal growth, relationships, and contributions to society.Moreover, individuals who have favorite programs often become obsessed with them, particularly when they are on air. This obsession can lead to an unhealthy attachment, causing people to prioritize watching television over other important aspects of their lives, such as work, study, or spending time with loved ones. The constant need to keep up with the latest episodes can also create stress and anxiety, as individuals feel pressured to stay current with their favorite shows. In conclusion, while television may have its benefits, its negative effects on human interaction, priorities, and obsession cannot be ignored. It is essential to maintain a balance between watching television and engaging in other aspects of life to ensure a healthy and well-rounded lifestyle.

question: Some people like to communicate by e-mail or voice mail. Other people like to communicate by telephone or face-to-face. Which type of communication do you prefer and why?
human: Although many people prefer communicating by telephone or face-to-face, personally I believe that communicating by e-mails or voice mails is better. There are several reasons to support this idea which I would like to mention in this essay.Firstly, communicating by e-mail is easy. Many people have problems with calling a person that they are not acquainted with. In this case it is not so difficult to write an e-mail or to leave a voice mail because even shy people feel themselves more confident.Secondly, you can write an e-mail at any time of the day. As for me, I work and study at the university and I don't have spare time during the day. I get home at about midnight and I still need to answer some questions and to solve some routine problems. I might not have time to call a person or to meet with him or her in an appropriate time so for me it is better to leave a voice mail.Thirdly, when you write an e-mail you have enough time to think carefully about what you are writing and how it would be better to express yourself. For example, you can change the word order or you can choose more appropriate style to sound more polite. When you speak face-to-face you are not as able to control every word as you are when you write an e-mail.And finally, there is no chance to disturb people by sending them an e-mail. You should not worry about interrupting an important conversation or some other business.To sum up, I would like to say that for me both options of communicating are possible, but if this is an important and not urgent question I would prefer to answer it by means of internet or voice mail.
llm: The advent of technology has revolutionized the way we communicate, and various methods have emerged as a result. While many people prefer communicating by telephone or face-to-face, I firmly believe that communicating via emails or voice mails is superior. This stance is grounded in several compelling reasons, which I will outline in this essay.First and foremost, email and voice mail communication is remarkably easy and convenient. For individuals who struggle with the prospect of calling someone they are not familiar with, it can be daunting. In such scenarios, writing a voice mail or email is significantly less intimidating. This ease of communication facilitates smoother interactions, especially in professional or formal contexts where one might not have a prior relationship with the recipient.Another significant advantage of email and voice mail is the flexibility they offer in terms of timing. Unlike telephone calls or face-to-face meetings, which require both parties to be available at the same time, it is possible to compose and send an email at any hour of the day. This aspect is particularly beneficial for individuals with busy schedules or those who operate in different time zones. As for me, it provides the opportunity to gather my thoughts and articulate them clearly before sending a message, which often leads to more effective and clear communication.In conclusion, the benefits of communicating through emails or voice mails, including ease and flexibility, make them a preferable method of communication in today's fast-paced world. They cater to a wide range of communication needs, from personal to professional, and offer a convenient and efficient way to stay connected.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement "haste makes waste" use specific reasons and examples.
human: This saying is stating that every fast and not well thought decision is a wasted one. In my opinion, this statement is completely true, for these few reasons:For one thing, making a quick decision means that it's not very thought out, and that it hasn't been checked from all its aspects. Consequently, making quick decisions leads to probable bad results. For example: if someone decided to quit his job without really thinking about the alternative, or a plan B, he could end up being unemployed, because of his speedy decision.In addition, making a rushed decision could also mean that the person is missing out on a potential opportunity. In another word, if this person had waited and thought his decision through he wouldn't have missed out on the job opening in the same firm, but at a different position. Hence, he wouldn't have been unemployed.Not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. To put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst.As can be seen from this, is that a hurried decision is almost never a good one. That's why one should always study his decision carefully and slowly, to ensure that the decision that the person is making is the best for him.
llm: The old adage "haste makes waste" rings true in the context of decision-making. Every fast and not well-thought-out decision is indeed a wasted one, as it often leads to probable bad results. Making quick decisions without careful consideration can have far-reaching and devastating consequences. Hurried decisions, made in the heat of the moment, can not only go to waste but also affect the entire life of the person making them.When we rush into decisions without weighing the pros and cons, we increase the likelihood of errors and mistakes. This is because our minds are not fully engaged, and we may overlook crucial details or alternative perspectives. As a result, we may end up with outcomes that are contrary to our goals and aspirations. Furthermore, the consequences of such decisions can be long-lasting, influencing not only our immediate circumstances but also our future prospects.The repercussions of impulsive decisions can be severe, impacting various aspects of our lives, including our relationships, careers, and overall well-being. For instance, a hasty decision to quit a job or end a relationship can lead to financial instability, emotional distress, and a loss of social connections. Similarly, a rushed decision to invest in a business or financial venture can result in significant financial losses, damaging our credit score and reputation.In conclusion, it is essential to approach decision-making with caution and deliberation. Taking the time to reflect on our choices, seeking advice from others, and considering multiple perspectives can help us make informed and thoughtful decisions. By doing so, we can avoid the pitfalls of hasty decisions and create a more secure and prosperous future for ourselves. As the saying goes, "patience is a virtue," and in the context of decision-making, it is a virtue that can save us from the waste and regret that often accompanies hurried and ill-conceived choices.

question: Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Nowadays the automobile is one of the most significant forms of transportation in everyday life. Many people own cars and use them daily, which clearly shows how important they are. Generally speaking, I definitely agree with the statement that cars have improved modern life, for several reasons.Firstly, people are now able to overcome long distances in a short amount of time, which leads to numerous advantages. For example in relationships. Many people are now able to maintain relationships over great distances because they can visit each other regularly by using their vehicle. From my personal experience I recall that my car has always been a great help to see my childhood friends very often although I lived in another city. I was also able to establish a relationship with a man living 89 kilometers away. Thanks to my car we could see each other at the weekends and are still a happy couple today. Without my automobile we would probably not have been able to develop a relationship.In addition, cars increase the chance of employment because people are able to drive to work and can work further away from home. Furthermore, they are more flexible. My father for example has always been working all around Germany and because of that earned more money. He used his car to drive to the other end of the country, worked there during the week and came home for the weekend. If he had no car, he wouldn't be able to see his family at the weekends so for him his automobile is a great benefit - not only in financial but also in social terms.Finally, the automobile allows people to travel more often and thus get to know the world. If people do not own cars they are likely to stay in their hometown or village most of their life. They are mainly using public transport and are thus limited in accessing certain areas. There are still places in nearly every country in the world that cannot be reached by public transportation and can only be visited by car. As a result, people who own a vehicle have greater access to more places and will see more of the world.In conclusion, the above stated reasons clearly outweigh the fact that cars cause a lot of pollution because they provide flexibility, which is important in nearly all areas of life. Travelling, social life and employment are highly dependent on the flexibility of a person and there is nothing in the world that makes more flexible than an own car.
llm: The automobile is undoubtedly one of the most significant forms of transportation in everyday life. Its impact on modern society is immense, and its importance cannot be overstated. Many people own cars and use them daily, which clearly shows how integral they are to our daily routines. The convenience and flexibility that cars provide have made them an essential part of our lives, and it is hard to imagine a world without them.The automobile has revolutionized the way we travel, allowing people to move freely and easily from one place to another. This has enabled people to travel more often, exploring new destinations and experiencing different cultures. As a result, people are able to broaden their horizons, get to know the world, and develop a deeper understanding of the diversity and complexity of human societies. Whether it's a road trip across the country or a short drive to a nearby city, the automobile has made it possible for people to explore and discover new places, fostering a sense of adventure and curiosity.Moreover, the automobile has also had a significant impact on the economy and social structures. It has enabled people to commute to work, access goods and services, and connect with others, thereby facilitating economic growth and social interaction. The automobile has also created new industries and job opportunities, contributing to the overall development of societies. In conclusion, the automobile is a vital part of modern life, and its significance extends far beyond its functional purpose as a mode of transportation. It has transformed the way we live, work, and interact with each other, and its importance will only continue to grow in the future.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: It is better for children to choose jobs that are similar to their parents job than to choose jobs that are very different from their parents jobs.
human: When choosing a job, one need to consider it thoroughly. Whether to choose a job which is similar to parents' job or not, different people may hold different opinions. As far as I am concerned, I think choosing the job that is similar to parents' jobs could benefit to one's career. First of all, as parents are involved in the same environment, they could thus support much more to their children, such as domain knowledge and industry-related information. For example, my father is a software programmer, and he indeed teaches me a lot in programming and some computer knowledge. Whenever I met a difficulty, I would reach him for consulting. Because he has many experiences, I could save enormous time in finding solution. This truly makes me more competitive than my colleagues. If I worked in the different field from my father, I would have faced much difficulty than I do now.Nevertheless, since parents have worked in tens of years, they have accumulated a rich network in a certain industry. They have a deep insight in it and could provide much support to their children. For instance, they know which company has better welfare or provides better education. Moreover, their friends in the same industry can even help to write recommendation letters to some certain companies. It is undoubted that a good recommendation letter is extraordinary important in this competitive society. When others are still struggling in preparing their resume, one with a good recommendation letter has already passed the first stage in the interviewing process. Some may argue that as time is different, the condition of job market is completely different. Therefore, choosing a job similar to one's parents' is not always a correct decision. I agree with this opinion to some extent, but when it comes to the trend, no one can predict it correctly. The condition of job market changes enormously fast like a flash, so that there is no way to predict any job can be popular for 30 years or more.In considering whether one should choose a job similar to his or her parents', I have mentioned a few reasons that one can get more support from his or her parents if they are in the same industry. I believe parents can lead their children to a more smooth career path.
llm: The age-old adage "like father, like son" takes on a new meaning when it comes to choosing a career path. Opting for a job similar to that of one's parents can have a profound impact on one's professional journey. By following in their parents' footsteps, individuals can leverage the wealth of knowledge and experience that their parents have accumulated over the years. As parents are already familiar with the industry and its intricacies, they can offer invaluable guidance and support to their children, helping them navigate the complexities of the job market.One of the primary advantages of choosing a job similar to one's parents' is the domain knowledge and industry-related information that they can provide. Having spent years working in the same field, parents have a deep understanding of the industry's nuances, challenges, and opportunities. They can share their expertise with their children, providing them with a competitive edge in the job market. Moreover, parents can also offer valuable insights into the company culture, professional etiquette, and best practices, all of which are essential for success in any profession.Some may argue that the job market has undergone significant changes over time, and therefore, parents' experience may not be directly applicable to their children's career. However, I firmly believe that parents can still play a vital role in guiding their children towards a smooth career path. While the job market may have evolved, the fundamental principles of professionalism, hard work, and dedication remain unchanged. Parents can impart these timeless values to their children, helping them develop a strong foundation for their professional journey. Furthermore, parents can also help their children build a network of contacts and connections within the industry, which can be invaluable in securing job opportunities and advancing in their careers. In conclusion, choosing a job similar to one's parents' can be a wise decision, as it allows individuals to tap into their parents' wealth of knowledge and experience, setting them up for success in their chosen career path.

question: Should we pay professional athletes (entertainers) a high salary? (Do professional athletes deserve their high salary?)Ê
human: Professional athletes and entertainers earn a huge amount of money that is hard to imagine. Most of the people spending their whole life can never achieve this. This salary gap between those famous people and us leads to a question-do those professional athletes and entertainers deserve this money? From my prospect, I believe that they do deserve this high payment.First of all, a worker's salary can properly reflect his/her competence and value on his/her career. Therefore, those who are paid high salaries must exceed others and achieve something incredible in certain ways. They are not paid for no reason. As we are now live in a competent world, we must show ourselves to be great enough so as to convince the employer that we deserve a better payment. It's all the same in every profession. That's why the richest athletes usually correspond to the greatest athletes in their fields, namely Michael Jordan or Tiger Woods.Second, such high salaries can also guarantee and support the athlete's great performances. Most of us only see the luxurious side of a rich athlete and ignore how may difficulties they've gone through and how much cost they've thrown into investing themselves. They shall reap within their high salaries. In other words, if they are not paid high enough in order to conform to their performances, there might not be such brilliant performances for us to be amazed. Some people might argue that the gap between the rich athletes and normal people is so huge that it seems to be unfair. However, in my opinion, as long as everyone has equal chances to pursue his/her dreams and careers, that would be fair. Fairness is not about equal payments for everyone, but equal chances to acquire the same goal or accomplishment.In conclusion, high salary for athletes is what they deserve in accordance with their own achievements and also a guarantee for quality performances. It is a positive encouragement for many more talented people to contribute to the world of athletics and entertainment, giving us awesome performances to enjoy.
llm: The salaries of professional athletes and entertainers have long been a subject of fascination and debate. It is not uncommon for these individuals to earn millions of dollars, a sum that is hard to imagine for the average person. Some people might argue that the gap between the rich athletes and normal people is so huge that it seems to be unfair. However, from my perspective, I believe that they do deserve this high payment.Firstly, a worker's salary can properly reflect his or her competence. Professional athletes and entertainers possess exceptional skills and talents that are honed through years of dedication and hard work. Their unique abilities set them apart from others, and their salaries are a reflection of their value in the industry. Just like any other profession, where individuals with specialized skills and expertise are compensated accordingly, athletes and entertainers should also be paid based on their exceptional abilities.Secondly, such high salaries can guarantee and support the athlete's great performances. The pressure to perform at the highest level is immense, and the financial rewards can serve as a motivator to push them to excel. With high salaries, athletes and entertainers can focus solely on their craft, without worrying about financial stability, allowing them to deliver outstanding performances that entertain and inspire millions of people worldwide. Moreover, these high salaries also incentivize them to maintain a high level of physical fitness, to continuously improve their skills, and to be role models for their fans.In conclusion, while the salaries of professional athletes and entertainers may seem excessive to some, I firmly believe that they deserve their high payments. Their unique talents, exceptional skills, and the value they bring to the industry justify their salaries. Moreover, these high payments are essential in guaranteeing and supporting their great performances, which bring joy and entertainment to millions of people around the world.

question: Should we require our young children (aged 5-10) to learn music and art in addition to math, science, history and language?
human: Every parents expect their children to be outstanding and successful. In order to achieve this, they start cultivating their children when they are very young. In addition to basic knowledge like language or science, music and art are usually on the must-learn list of the parents. In my opinion, I agree that children should learn music and art in a young age because they do contribute several merits to them. First, it's very suitable for children to develop senses of music and art when they are young. Children absorb things quickly and they bear exact the ability needed in music and art-imagination. Music and art are not like math or language which has more strict rules. They are more abstract, requiring creativity and imagination to be enriched. Children are privileged to have these abilities because they are given more freedom and their imagination has not yet been killed due to reality circumstances. Even if their performances are just some simple drawings and melodies, music and art still bring out children's joy of flying in imagination.Second, music and art are life-long cultivation worthy of investing. They teach us how to appreciate beauty and express feelings in a creative way. They are essential to our spiritual life. Therefore, even if children are not going to be great musicians or artists, learning music and art is still worthy because it can nourish your temper and serve as a leisure.However, some people might argue that parents shouldn't put so much stress on children, since learning too many skills seems to be a burden for them. In my opinion, it depends on how you value these learning activities to be like. If parents push their 5 years old child to play piano 8 hours a day just like a professional performer, that might be too much. In a child stage, music and art are more like an open door to introduce the art world than training area to acquire specific skills. In this way, it will not be such pressure on children. In conclusion, young age is the perfect time for children to learn music and art and they are indeed valuable to people not only in their young stage, but in every stage. Music and art can accompany a spirit as long as they are given the chance to enter his/her life.
llm: The Importance of Music and Art in Childhood DevelopmentWhen it comes to a child's education, parents often prioritize core subjects such as mathematics, science, and language. However, the arts, including music and visual art, are also essential components of a well-rounded education. In fact, music and art are usually at the top of the must-learn list for many parents. I firmly believe that this is a wise decision, as these creative pursuits are crucial for developing a child's senses and fostering a lifelong appreciation for beauty and self-expression.In my opinion, it is highly suitable for children to develop their senses through music and art when they are young. These creative activities stimulate a child's imagination, cognitive skills, and emotional intelligence, laying the foundation for a lifelong journey of discovery and exploration. By introducing music and art at a young age, children can develop their fine motor skills, hand-eye coordination, and critical thinking abilities. Moreover, these activities provide a platform for children to express themselves,, which is essential for building confidence, creativity, and individuality.Investing in music and art education is a worthwhile endeavor, as it can have a profound impact on a child's personality and character. These creative pursuits can nourish a child's temperament, teaching them valuable lessons about perseverance, discipline, and self-expression. By cultivating a love for music and art, children can develop a deeper understanding of themselves and the world around them, leading to a more empathetic, open-minded, and well-rounded individual. In conclusion, music and art are essential components of a child's education, and parents should prioritize these creative pursuits to give their children the best possible start in life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is explaining how that subject will help in their lives outside school.
human: There are many ways of teaching. Some people believe that strictly and carefully presenting theories in the class is the best way of teaching, while others assert that involving applications on that theory will be more convincing. In my opinion, I agree with the second idea that the best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is to explain how that subject can help and apply to their lives outside school.First of all, by explaining how the subject contributes to daily life, students will have vivid impression on that subject thus become more interested and active in acquiring the knowledge on that subject. Take chemistry for example, merely memorizing the names of the substances and the structural formulas seems to be very boring, while representing where and how those chemical reactions really happen near students will raise their curiosity and lead them to digest those theories learned from the class. While I was in senior high school, my chemical teacher once showed us how the detergent dissolves oil by an experiment and later on taught us how to describe this process with formal structural formulas. This type of learning method is more fun and eventually the results are good. I connected the visual images of that experiment with the formula and I barely forget, even though now I'm not studying chemistry anymore.Second, by bridging the theories with daily life events, students are given the chance to apply knowledge to their lives and develop their own ability of problem-solving. This will address students' interests because it's the assignment that needs real life participation. For example, in law class, students are informed their rights and duties and they are taught how they can apply law to different situations that might happen upon them. When any one of the situations occurs, they can think independently and figure out how to react.In conclusion, using life experiences and examples to demonstrate the knowledge on a subject is an effective way to attract students' attention and keep them eager on learning, not only because it reinforces students' impression on the knowledge but also invites students to practice the knowledge out on their own.
llm: The age-old problem of disengaged students has long plagued the education system. Many students view school subjects as mere academic exercises, devoid of practical relevance to their lives. However, in my opinion, the best way for teachers to pique students' interest in a subject is to illustrate its real-world applications and relevance to their daily lives. By doing so, teachers can make the subject more relatable, accessible, and ultimately, more engaging.When students are shown how a particular subject contributes to their everyday lives, they are more likely to develop a deeper appreciation and understanding of its significance. This approach not only makes the subject more interesting but also helps students to see the value and purpose of learning. For instance, a math teacher can explain how mathematical concepts are used in cooking, finance, or architecture, making the subject more tangible and applicable. Similarly, a science teacher can demonstrate how scientific principles are used in medical treatments, transportation, or environmental conservation, highlighting the subject's relevance to students' lives.By explaining the practical applications of a subject, students are likely to form a vivid impression of its importance and become more active in acquiring knowledge. They will begin to see the connections between the subject matter and their own experiences, sparking their curiosity and motivating them to learn more. As a result, students will become more engaged, participatory, and enthusiastic about learning, leading to a more effective and enjoyable educational experience. Ultimately, teachers who can make their subject relevant and applicable to students' lives will be rewarded with a more attentive, interested, and motivated classroom, where learning is a collaborative and rewarding experience for all.

question: Governments should focus its budget more on environmental protection than on economic developments.
human: Environmental protection and economic developments might be the biggest issues in the 21st century. They are both important because they are vital to human's future and welfare. However, since the budget and the recourse are limited, governments must choose between these two issues. In my opinion, I believe that tackling down environmental problems is of the first priority rather than economic developments. The following are reasons why. First, environmental protection is far more urgent than economic developments. All the living creatures live together on our mother Earth and she is the only one. Without Earth, whatever great civil constructions and economic achievements will end up in vain because we will all perish as she's gone. Just like a man that needs a healthy body, all the living creatures as a whole needs a strong planet as well. Second, the influence on environmental problems are boarder and more profound than economic issues. Environmental problems are global rather than local, which means that no countries can be spared from these problems. Take global warming for example, when the temperature increases, the whole globe is affected, suffering the hotter weather together. The melting ice mountain not only jeopardizes habitats of animals living in the polar region, but its effects of the rising sea level also endangers the residents living in the small island near the equator, since the rising sea water could drown them. Environmental issues can not be divided by nationality because all humans are simply entwined together by our only home-Earth.Some people might argue that economic issues are global and critical as well thus can not be put aside. They may say that if the economic is in a very bad situation, people would revolt instantly, while environmental problems seem to be more like chronic diseases that would not burst out right away. However, the truth is that we've been encountering so many sighs and warnings of global climate anomalies and other environmental crisis right now. It would be unwise to still deny the truth and keep focusing on economic developments and unfortunately, usually the economic developments are even the causes of environmental damages.In conclusion, environmental conservation is more essential than economic developments in the aspects of urgency and ranges of influence. As mentioned in the second paragraph, how can a man live happily if he is unhealthy? Similarly, how can we live safely and joyfully when our home is devastated by, ironically, by ourselves?
llm: The 21st century is plagued by two of the most pressing issues: environmental protection and economic development. Both are crucial to the future and welfare of humanity, making them a subject of great importance and debate. While some argue that economic development should take precedence, I firmly believe that addressing environmental problems should be the top priority.Environmental protection is essential for the very survival of our planet. The alarming rates of pollution, deforestation, and climate change pose a significant threat to the health and well-being of humans and wildlife alike. If left unaddressed, these issues will have catastrophic consequences, including the loss of biodiversity, erratic weather patterns, and scarcity of natural resources. The future of our planet and its inhabitants depends on our ability to mitigate these environmental problems.On the other hand, economic development is vital for improving the standard of living and reducing poverty. However, I believe that environmental protection should take precedence over economic development. A healthy environment is the foundation upon which economic growth can be sustained. Without a stable and thriving ecosystem, economic development will be short-lived and ultimately, futile. In fact, studies have shown that investing in environmental protection can actually stimulate economic growth and create new job opportunities.In conclusion, while both environmental protection and economic development are important, I strongly believe that tackling environmental problems should be our first priority. The long-term benefits of a healthy environment far outweigh the short-term gains of economic development. It is our responsibility to ensure that our actions today do not compromise the future of our planet and its inhabitants. By prioritizing environmental protection, we can create a sustainable and prosperous future for generations to come.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
